The loan that he has requested will be used to purchase two cows that will produce milk to make cheese, which will be sold to the customers that purchase goods from his wife's business. This will increase both of their incomes and support both of them.

In the future, he would like to acquire land on which to keep his animals. He currently rents land, which is more expensive.

loans.use: to buy two milk-producing cows.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her son appears in the photo.

Amneh is a 46-year-old married woman from Gaza city. She lives with her husband and four sons in a simple home. Her husband is a worker with a very low wage which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Their eldest son would like to work to help his family. He would like to buy a rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders in the city. It is hard work and he needs to work long hours to earn a good income to help his family and improve their living conditions. 

Amneh took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a rickshaw for her son's work. This will increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for her son's work.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is forty-year-old Alpha. He is married and has three children, ages four, seven and nine. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a sister with her schooling. In 2003, Alpha established his business of selling blouses, slippers, sneakers, long dresses and ladies' bags. 

The business began to be self-reliant after coming from the village to the city. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,250,500 every month from this business. 

Alpha would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to pay for additional school shoes, socks, berets and belts to sell. He hopes that this loan can improve his stock and increase his profit. In the future he plans to establish a new stall for the sale of school items, and hopes to be able to make enough profit to be able to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for school shoes, socks, berets and belts to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lorena has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.   She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is improving step by step in his business.  The last two loans he got have really helped him buy more stock.  They changed his life and his family's.  His children are doing well in school, and his business is really doing well.

He is borrowing another loan of SSP 4,500 to enable him to expand his business and even to build his own premises and save on rent expenses. He also intends to employ more people in his business.

Adam is really happy about Finance Sudan Limited for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy items like powdered milk, powdered orange juice, sugar, etc., for his food store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  Mercedes has been raising livestock for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

Mercedes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en: Roquesa works hard to support her family.  She is married and has had a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines for the past 3 years.  Roquesa requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.  Roquesa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emma works hard to support her family.  She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from pig fattening.  Emma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to expand her business.  

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Frederick. He is single and has one child, age three. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a brother with his schooling. In 2008, Frederick established his business of selling mobile phone accessories. At first he started the business with CD recording, and now he sells mobile phone accessories, charging, recording and selling recharge cards. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are all sexes. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 922,500 Sierra Leone Leones every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to pay for additional phone batteries, chargers, head phones and CD plates. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and improve the shop. 

In the future, Frederick plans to expand the size of the shop and buy more stock. He hopes to be able to construct his own house from the proceeds of the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for phone batteries, chargers, head phones and CD plates.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is forty-five-year-old Mohamed. He is married and has three children, ages one, six and twelve. In 2007, Mohamed established his ladies' shoes, slippers, blouses, long dresses, shirts and T-shirt business. The business started after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 916,250 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mohamed requires this loan in order to pay for additional jeans, ladies' school shoes, bags and socks. He hopes that this loan can improve the stock and increase the profit. In the future, Mohamed plans to move to a shop and increase business. He hopes to be able to make enough profit to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for jeans, ladies' school shoes, bags and socks.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is twenty-six-year-old Mariama. She is married and has two children, ages two and five. In 2008, Mariama established her blouses, jeans, belts, beads, shirts, slippers and trousers business. She started to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,404,250 every month from this business. 

Mariama would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to pay for additional jeans, sneakers and belts. She hopes that this loan can improve the stock and raise the profit. In the future, Mariama plans to improve the shop with children's dresses, and she hopes to open another shop for a sister on the outskirts of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for jeans, sneakers and belts.

loans.name: Sheku T.

texts.en:
This is forty-six-year-old Sheku. He is married and has three children, ages seven, thirteen, and twenty-eight. In 1993, Sheku established his building materials business. The business started after losing his job and becoming self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults, contractors, and builders. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sheku requires a loan in order to pay for additional cement and shovels. He hopes that this loan can improve the stock and increase the profit. 

In the future, Sheku plans to expand his business to the outskirts of town, and he hopes to grow the business toward construction. He started selling scraps, and now sells building materials. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cement and shovels.

loans.name: Kadiig Moham

texts.en:
Moham is a client of Finance Sudan Limited.  He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients.  He is 38 years old and married with 3 children, 2 of whom go to school.

Moham is a businessman who runs a general store that sells sugar, salt, wheat flour, eggs, and many other household goods.  He has been in the business for 4 years now and has employed two people to help him.  He is borrowing a loan worth 4,500 South Sudanese pounds to expand the business.  This loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and to take care of the family.

loans.use: to buy more food items like sugar, wheat flour, and eggs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as coffee, soft drinks, sugar, salt, and detergent soap.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 24 years.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood and charcoal.  Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her store, including coffee, soft drinks, sugar, salt, and detergent.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

Catalina has been in this business for 20 years.  She also earns additional income from a general store and from raising livestock.  Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, 33, is married and has one child, age 7. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling. In 2007, Doris established her grocery business. She began her business because after she left school, there was no employment for her. 

Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Doris requires a loan in order to buy more drinks in very large quantities for resale. She would use the remaining money on transportation. 

In the future, Doris plans to become an international businesswoman and provide her children with a quality education. Through the additional income she will be able to educate her children, and she is still trying to travel to other countries. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell in her grocery business and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Teodora works hard to support her family.  She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen food.  Teodora is borrowing PHP 19,000 from NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Bregelia

texts.en:
Bregelia is 48 years old and married with one child.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Bregelia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bregelia has been in this business for 7 years and has borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Bregelia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daisylyn

texts.en:
Daisylyn, 41 years old, is a married woman with four children, who are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Daisylyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Daisylyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Betty John

texts.en: Betty is a client of Finance Sudan Limited. She is 36 years of age and a married mother of 3 children, 2 of whom go to school. She resides in Yei Town in South Sudan. She is a businesswoman who runs a retail shop. She has been in the business for about 4 years now. She is a borrowing a loan worth 3,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her to buy more stock for her shop. She intends to buy sodas, beer, biscuits, beans, sugar and many other retail goods so that she can serve her clients on a wider scale.

loans.use: To buy items like soda, beer, biscuits, beans, sugar and many others.

loans.name: Lojuan

texts.en: Since Lojuan changed his business from selling clothes to hardware, his business has been experiencing high returns. This is due to the previous loans he received. His business is doing very well. He used the previous loans to establish the business and now wants to borrow another loan of 4,000 South Sudanese Pounds to expand the business even more by buying more iron sheets, cement, nails and other things for his hardware store.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cement and nails to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 26 years old and has one child who is in school. She has a firewood business in the Philippines.

Liezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a electronic mobile-loading business in the Philippines.

Jessica has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old, and she is married, with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Leonila has been farming vegetables for five years, and she also earns income from food-vending and a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Doña María Isabel tiene una edad de 50 años, visionaria, emprendedora y muy luchadora la cual se desempeña hasta hoy en día como comerciante y agricultora cultivando café, frijoles, maíz, pataste, yuca, huertas de plátano y banano. Ella también tiene una pequeña granja de aves de corral para venta ya que de esa manera también ella puede generar mayores ingresos para su familia y contribuir a la economía de su hogar. De sus 5 hijos 4 ya están casados y solo el menor vive con ella y su esposo el cual se involucra en las diferentes actividades de campo en compañía de sus padres. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a una distancia de 15 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada en bus.

Sus metas son las de poder extender sus cultivos de café y huerta cultivando una manzana y media más de tierra para obtener una mayor y mejor producción de café y plátano y venderlos a precios competitivos en el mercado. De esa manera ella podrá contribuir a la economía de su hogar apoyando a su esposo en los diferentes gastos del hogar como alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. para el bienestar de sus hijos y su familia. Por lo que ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual pueda comprar fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas entre otros para su proyecto
texts.en:
Maria Isabel, who is 50 years old, is visionary, enterprising, and very combative. She has applied these traits up to the present as a merchant and farmer, cultivating coffee, beans, corn, christophenes, cassava, and orchards of plantains and bananas. She also has a small farmyard with farm fowl for sale. In this way she can generate greater income for her family and contribute to the household economy. Of her 5 children, 4 are married: only one minor child lives with her and her husband and is still involved in his parents' different rural activities. Maria's coffee fields are located some 15 kilometers from her home, requiring her to go by bus.

Maria's goals are to expand her cultivation of coffee and her orchards, cultivating 1 1/2 manzanas of land, in order to obtain a larger and better production of coffee and plantains to sell at competitive prices in the market. In this manner, she will be able to contribute to the household economy, helping her husband with the different household expenses, including food, clothing, medicine, etc., for the wellbeing of her children and family. That's why she is approaching the COMIXMUL cooperative, seeking financing to purchase fertilizers, manure, and insecticides, among other inputs for her project.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs for her expanded coffee and plantain crops.

loans.name: Maria Maximina

texts.es:
María Maximina es una mujer de 37 años de edad ama de casa y agricultora madre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian, con un grado de escolaridad incompleta cursado hasta el tercer grado la cual vive muy feliz. Ella en compañía de su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra y cultivo de café desde hace muchos años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra siendo este rubro en su familia una tradición. Ella también se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol en tiempo frio y agradece a DIOS por tener un terreno propio en donde cultivar el cual está ubicado en la misma propiedad en la cual está construida su casa de habitación por lo que la asistencia y mantenimiento es más constante.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ampliara sus cultivos de café sembrando más y expandiendo sus cultivos mejorando la economía en su hogar comprando abono y fertilizantes para dar mantenimiento a los cultivos actuales y a los que planea cultivar. Con esta compra ella podrá satisfacer muchas necesidades por medio de las ganancias como el apoyo a sus hijos en sus estudios, compra de víveres, vestimenta, medicina con muchas restricciones entre otros que son necesarios para su hogar y para el mejoramiento de sus vidas.
texts.en:
María Maximina is 37 years old.  She is both a housewife and a farmer, and a mother to six children, only two of whom are in school.  María only completed up to the end of third grade, but she enjoyed school.  María, alongside her husband, has been making a living in farming, sowing and growing coffee for many years.  María learned to work the land when she was taught by her parents.  In her family, this work is now a tradition.  María also grows corn and beans in the cold season.  She thanks God that she has her own land that she can work.  Her plot of land is on the same property as her house so the crops are constantly looked after.

María has applied for a loan from COMIXMUL in order to expand her coffee crops, sowing more and having more plants.  This will help to improve her household's financial situation as she buys manure and fertilisers to maintain the crops that she already has, plus the ones that she plans to start growing.  With these purchases, María will be able to cover many costs with the profits. She will be able to support her children with their education, buy supplies, buy clothing and medicines, and pay other necessary household costs.  This will improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 37 years old and married; she has three children. Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more goods to sell at her general store, like noodles, cooking oil, eggs, candies, and coffee. Mildred has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her general store, like noodles, cooking oil, and eggs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Angelita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools, for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Mariatu Nana

texts.en:
Mariatu, 47, is married to an accountant and has three children aged 26, 21 and 17 years. 

Previously, Mariatu was a civil servant, but she retired and went to the Ivory Coast to seek a visa to go to the United States. Unfortunately, she was denied one, and when she went back home, there was no job for her. With her remaining money, she opened her provisions and drinks shop in 2006.

Working six days a week and ten hours a day, Mariatu earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan of 4,500,000 SLL in order to buy crates of soft drinks, crates of Maltina, cartons of sardines, and cartons of Peak Milk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL. 

Mariatu has improved her business considerably and can now withstand competitions from neighboring businesses. Moreover, her children are still receiving quality educations. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks, crates of Maltina, cartons of sardines and cartons of Peak Milk for .

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business selling charcoal, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income from a bakery.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is 31 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for seven years.

Cherry Mae requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs. She has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business activity.

Cherry Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.  Jonalyn requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lino Antonio

texts.es: Lino Antonio se ha dedicado por más de 50 años a la producción de café. Comenzo al lado de su padre y sus hermanos y alli aprendió todo lo necesario para desarrollar esta actividad. Para esta cosecha necesita comprar fertilizante pues hace poco sembro planta nueva de café y quiere que crezcan fuertes para que den un buen grano con calidad de exportación. Además de producir café también se dedica a la siembra de hoja de plátano que sirve para dar sombra a los cafetales y tiene mucha demanda en el mercado pues la utilizan para preparar tamales.
texts.en: Lino Antonio has been growing coffee for more than 50 years. He started alongside his father and siblings and there he learnt all he needed to know to be able to grow coffee. For this harvest he needs to buy fertilizer since he planted new coffee plants a little while ago and he wants the plants to grow strongly so that they give a good bean of export quality. As well as producing coffee he also grows banana leaves, which provide shade for the coffee plantation and also there is a strong demand for them in the market since they are used to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 32 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jasmin has been in this business for two years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

Jasmin is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 55 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julita is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Julita has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 27 años, es divorciada y tiene 02 hijos de 10 y 03 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Isabel consiste en la venta de comida los fines de semana, los sábados y domingos sale a la vereda de su casa y se alista para empezar con sus ventas, lleva 6 meses en este negocio, al principio le fue un poco complicado, pero poco a poco ha logrado mantener el ritmo de ventas.
Le gusta mucho realizar su trabajo, tiene tiempo para poder brindar a sus hijos, además tiene buenos ingresos, tiene muchos planes en mente, le gustaría tener un negocio propio, pero por ahora solo desea poner su fuente de soda y así no depender de nadie para poder generar sus ingresos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará pollos para preparar sus comidas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 27 years old and is divorced with 2 children aged 10 and 3 who live with her in her own house. Isabel's work consists of selling food at the weekends. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes out onto the pavement outside her house and gets ready to start her sales. She has been in this business for 6 months; at the beginning it was a bit difficult for her but gradually she has been able to maintain the level of sales. She really enjoys her work as she is able to spend time with her children and she also makes a good income. She has lots of plans in her head; she would like to have her own business, but for the time being she just wants to set up her cafeteria so that she is not dependent on anyone else to make her income.

On this occasion she is asking for 1500 soles. She is very grateful for the financial help she is getting to be able to make progress in life and she promises to pay her instalments punctually. She will use the sum requested to buy chickens for preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy chickens for making her food.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is a hardworking entrepreneur who raises livestock in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Michel has been in this business for 3 years, and she earns more income from fishing.

Michel has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a livestock-raising business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica  alquilar video juegos. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que ha través de los financiamientos  pudo invertir en la compra de equipos, lo cual fue de gran ayuda para aumentar sus ingresos. Solicita este nuevo crédito para  dar mantenimiento  a sus equipos y mejoras en su negocio, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este crédito será de mucha ayuda  para su entorno familiar, ya que podrá tener una mejor situación económica.  Su meta es expandir su negocio, considera que con esfuerzo y dedicación podrá lograrlo.
texts.en:
Ana is originally from Managua, married and the mother of four children. She is a businessperson who rents video games. She is pleased with the support that Kiva and MiCredito have given her. Through the loans she has received she was able to buy game consoles which has increased her revenues greatly. 

Ana is requesting this loan to do maintenance on the machines and improvements to her shop with the goal of improving service to her customers. This loan will help improve her family environment a lot as she will be in a better economic situation.  Her dream is to expand her business. She thinks that with effort and dedication she can do it.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her equipment and make some improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Adelina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gear for fishing.

Adelina has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gear for fishing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 22 años, es soltera y vive en una casa alquilada con sus padres. Juana se dedica a la venta de comida, desde muy temprano abre su restaurante, ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, ahí tiene a la venta todo tipo de comidas regionales, desde lo mas simple hasta las comidas mas complicadas, además vende algunos artículos de decoración y artículos personales, se inicio con un negocio muy pequeño, pero gracias al esfuerzo que siempre puso pudo crecer de a poco, tiene buenas ventas ya que ofrece todo tipo de productos y es la garantía que sus clientes esperan siempre para poder ir y encontrar lo que deseen. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes tales como arroz, plátanos, azúcar, entre otros;  para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is 22 years old, single and lives in a rented house with her parents. Juana sells food. She opens her restaurant early. It is located in the city market. She sells all kinds of regional foods from the simplest to the most complicated. She also sells home decoration goods and personal effects. She started out as a very small business but thanks to her efforts it has grown little by little. She has good sales as she offers all kinds of products, which guarantees that her customers can come and find what they want.

At this time Juana is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy ingredients like rice, plantains, sugar etc. to continue with her business. She is very content to have this financial support. With it she feels that she can continue to expand her business. She promises to pay her installments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, plantains, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Ailene requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional tools and gear for her fishing business.

In the future, Ailene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and gear for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is single, and she has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of food products to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for three years now.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of food products to sell

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Малохат мама двоих детей и верная жена. Ей 29 лет. Она берет кредит, чтобы оплатить за учебу. У нее есть педагогическое образование, но для того чтобы продолжить свою работу ей необходимо получить второе экономическое образование. Малохат поступила в Худжандский университет на экономиста. Так как у нее платное обучение, она должна оплатить за год вперед. Поэтому она берет кредит на сумму 550 долларов США за один год обучения. Она хорошо училась в школе и с отличием окончила педагогический институт. Сейчас она работает в Хумо. 
Малохат справляется с работой. Она любит свою работу и чтобы продолжить работу ей необходимо экономическое образование. Малохат уверенна, что сможет проучиться на отлично и узнать еще больше о своей профессии.
texts.en:
Malohat is the mother of two children and a faithful wife. She is 29 years old. She is taking a loan to pay tuition. She has a teaching degree, but in order to continue her work she needs to receive a second economics education. Malohat enrolled in the Khujand University as an economist. Since she has paid training, she must pay for the year ahead. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US $550 for one year of schooling. She was a good student and graduated with honors from the pedagogical institute. She is now working at Humo. 

Malohat is up to the job. She loves her work and in order to continue she needs an economics education. Malohat is confident that she will be able to learn to excellence and to understand more about her profession.

loans.use: to pay tuition in order in the future to receive a higher education in economics

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Emily requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, aged 36, is a married woman who has five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina has a business, selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 48 years old, and she is married, with six children.  Four of her children are still in school.  Leonisa works very hard to provide for them.

Leonisa runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like biscuits, snack foods, candies, juices, etc., to sell in her general store.

Leonisa has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items, such as biscuits, snack foods, candies, juices, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, like biscuits, snack foods, candies, juices, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replant her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суюмкан 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Суюмкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Суюмкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Суюмкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы,2 теленка, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,400 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суюмкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Суюмкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на приданное для своей старшей дочери.
texts.en:
Suyumkan is 52 years old, married, and is raising three children with her husband. Suyumkan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Suyumkan is involved in raising livestock, having started 16 years ago with the purchase of cattle at 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Suyumkan today has on her homstead: three dairy cows, two calves, and eight sheep. Monthly income reaches 5,400 com (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Suyumkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the count of livestock. 

Suyumkan plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic animals and plans to save money as a dowry for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fruits and vegetables-vending business in the Philippines.

Vivian requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for two years now and also earns additional income from food-vending and a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is an experienced agronomist from the village Qarakert, in Armavir region. His family comprises his wife and two sons. To meet the family's daily needs, Norayr drives a taxi in addition to his farming work. His youngest son is employed in the private sector, but his salary so low that he cannot take care of the family either. With the help of his family, Norayr breeds livestock, including cows, sheep, and piglets. He also cultivates alfalfa and apricots. Norayr's sons help him a lot in everyday activities related to farming. 

The family is now eager to develop their agribusiness. They need a loan of USD 1500, which they will use to purchase three pigs and two calves, and to buy some feed for them. Norayr and his family will be very thankful to all the lenders for their good will and support, for raising the needed amount of loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and two calves, and to buy some feed for them

loans.name: Rozakhan

texts.ru: Розе 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 сыновей. У Розы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Роза занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Розы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, а также имеет 0,40 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,200 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Роза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Roza is 42 years old, married, and is raising five sons. Roza has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Roza has been involved in raising livestock and agriculture, having started five years ago with the purchase of livestock at 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Roza now has on her homestead: 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, and also has a 0.40-hectare land plot on which she annually grows beans, potatoes, and perennial grasses. Monthly income comes to 4,200 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Roza turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy one calf for increasing her livestock count.

Roza plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic livestock and plans to save money to build a new barn to protect the cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives with his family in Hayanist village. He lives with his wife, father, and two little kids. He has been involved in an agricultural business for more than eight years and is the only breadwinner of his family. Currently Suren breeds a livestock including cows, sheep, and pigs. Near the village where Suren lives, he also owns a plot of land where tomato is being cultivated. By selling agricultural products in the local markets, Suren gets the income, which is vital for his family's well-being.

So now, this hardworking farmer asks a loan of USD 3000. He will use it to purchase cows, pigs and forage. Suren has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately was not able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work during the more recent times, Suren was able to run his agricultural business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan is very important, for Suren to increase his farm and ensure a better life for his beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for cows, pigs, and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Almakan

texts.ru: Алмакан 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Алмакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алмакан занимается животноводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 4 теленка, имеется собственный земельный надел, размером 3,20 ГА, на которой она ежегодно со своей семьей сажает картофель и фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алмакан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алмакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Almakan is 59 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. Almakan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Almakan has been engaged in raising livestock, having started 40 years ago with the purchase of cattle at 2,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Almakan now has on her homestead: seven dairy cows and four calves, and has her own plot of land measuring 3.20 hectares, on which she annually grows potatoes and beans with her family. Monthly income reaches 12,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Almakan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase her count of livestock. 

Almakan plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorna is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Lorna has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like canned goods, milk, coffee, seasonings, and laundry soap.

Lorna has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like canned goods, milk, coffee, seasonings, and laundry soap.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, who is married, works hard to support her family with the fishing business she has been operating in the Philippines for five years now. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing gear for her enterprise.


In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea, a 41-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a direct-selling business in the Philippines for four years now.

Lea has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell such as sandals, lotion, body spray, bags, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products like sandals, lotion, body spray, bags, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 дочерей. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 31 год назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 5 бычков, 2 лошади, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married, and together with her husband raised four daughters. Bakhtygul has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Bakhtygul has been involved in raising livestock, having started 31 years ago with the purchase of cattle at 7,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Bakhtygul today has on her homestead: four dairy cows, five steers, two horses, and six sheep. Monthly income reaches 9,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase steers to increase the count of cattle.

Bakhtygul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic livestock and plans to save money to build a new barn for keeping cattle.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмире 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Элмиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Elmira is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising five children. Elmira has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Elmira is involved in raising livestock, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock at 3,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Elmira today has on her homestead: two dairy cows and five sheep. Monthly income reaches 4,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Elmira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to increase the count of livestock. 

Elmira plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic livestock and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria works hard to support her family. Macaria is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Macaria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.  In the future, Macaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila works hard to support her family. She is married and has business selling herbal products and dry goods in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years now.

Teofila requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of herbal products and dry goods to sell.

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy herbal products and dry goods to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 27 years old and has two children who are both in school.   Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been farming vegetables for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Teresita  would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years now.

Adelaida requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has business farming vegetables and root crops in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 42 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines.  Jonalyn has been farming rice and vegetables for 4 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Jonalyn is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Lolita has been in this business for 5 years.  She also earns additional income from direct-selling Avon products.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Almera

texts.en:
Almera works hard to support her family. Almera is married and has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Almera requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more Avon products to sell to her customers.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy Avon products to resell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and her three children are in school.

Maria Dolores has a business selling frozen food in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

Maria Dolores requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen food to sell.

Maria Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy frozen food to resell

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia Melodia, who is married, works hard to support her family.  She has been selling souvenirs in the Philippines for two years now.


Melodia has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more souvenir items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more souvenir items to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry has progressed well with the loans that he has received. His shop has improved and he now has many clients. He has been able to pay for his family's school fees and provided for his family well. 

Henry is now borrowing 4,500 South Sudanese Pounds so that he can buy more stock like wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and many other items.

He is very happy for the help that he has received from Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase items like flour, sugar and many other items.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, convive junto a su compañera de vida y sus 4 hijos.
 Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto con los demás miembros de su familia, sus hijos se van a la escuela, mientras ellos se dedican actividades agrícolas y de jornal para llevarle el sustento a sus hijos

él se dedica específicamente a la agricultura y a la ganadería oficios que aprendió de sus padres, desde pequeño y lo cual le genera ingresos además de realizar actividades de jornal.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un torito, para completar una pequeña yunta de bueyes que posee y arar su parcela, ademas de prestar el servicio de arado a otras personas de la zona y así obtener mejores ingresos para el sustento de la familia.

Su sueño, es que en un futuro poder adquirir,  un terreno donde tener sus animales; ya que actualmente no posee ninguno.
texts.en:
Rufino is 39 years old and studied as far as fifth grade. He lives with his life partner and their 4 children. He gets up with the other family members at 5am and the children go off to school while they carry out agricultural work and work as a day labourer to provide for their children. Rufino works specifically in agriculture and livestock, skills which he learnt from his parents from an early age and which provides him with an income as well as working as a day labourer. 

The loan Rufino is asking for is to buy a young bull to make up a small pair of oxen for ploughing his land, as well as providing a ploughing service to other people in the area to get more income to support his family. His dream is to be able one day to buy a plot of land to keep his animals on, as he does not currently have one.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгуль 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Бактыгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 33 years old, maried, and together with her husband is raising three children. Bakhtygul has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Bakhtygul is engaged in raising livestock, having started eight years ago with the purchase of livestock at 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Bakhtygul today has on her homestead: two dairy cows and two calves. Monthly income reaches 4,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to purchase a calf to increase the count of livestock. 

Bakhtygul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic animals and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Динары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,10 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль и картофельи 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Dinara is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Dinara has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Dinara is engaged in raising livestock and agriculture, having started 15 years ago with 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Dinara now has 1.10 hectares of arable land on which she annually grows beans and potatoes and one horse. Monthly income reaches 5,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Dinara turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase the count of livestock. 

Dinara plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the count of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Abduluraza Abdallahlim

texts.en:
Abduluraza is a young man, 28 years old. He is married with one child. He is a businessman who owns a general store that sells different types of food items. He has been in this business for about four years and has managed to employ two people to help him run the business. 
Abduluraza is borrowing 1,000 South Sudanese pounds to enable him buy more items like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, salt and sugar for his store.
He says the loan will also enable him to pay rent for his house.

loans.use: To buy items like rice, flour, sugar, salt, tea leaves

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 34 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Olivia works very hard to provide for them.

Olivia runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, etc. 

Oliva requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.   In the future, Olivia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Chakhfarsho

texts.ru: В городе Вахдат люди уже начали ориентироваться по магазину Чахфаршо. Чахфаршо открыл свой магазин в 1998 году. Когда он открыл свой магазин, ему было всего 18 лет, тогда работали считанные магазины и прилавки. Сейчас Чахфаршо 33 года. Он сумел добиться признаний в этой области. У него много постоянных клиентов. Если в молодом возрасте Чахфаршо работал для дохода, то сейчас он работает просто для клиентов, помогает им с выбором и доставляет нужные продукты из города. С помощью кредита он сможет поехать в столицу за продуктами и увеличить ассортимент продуктов, чтобы привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
In the town of Vahdat, people have already begun to focus on the Chakhfarsho's store. Chakhfarsho opened his store in 1998. When he opened his store, he was all of 18 years old, at which time he had worked at a few shops and stalls. Now, Chakhfarsho has been working for 33 years. He managed to build commitments in this area. He has many regular customers. If in his youth Chakhfarsho worked for income, then now he works only for the customers, helping them with their choices and delivering needed products throughout the town. 

With the help of a loan, he will be able to travel to the capital for products and to increase the range of goods in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: to purchase products with the aim of increasing the range of goods in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Carolina Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Carolina es originaria de Managua. Tiene 50 años de edad, madre soltera de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Gracias al apoyo que MiCredito y Kiva le han brindado ha podido aumentar su inventario y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar: anillos, pulseras, cadenas, perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, entre otros, con el fin de aumentar su clientela y brindar variedad en su negocio. Estima que al adquirir el crédito podrá realizar mejorar  en su local y por ende aumentar sus ingresos a través de la comercialización de sus productos. Se considera una persona autosuficiente la cual tiene capacidad de continuar su negocio de manera independiente.
texts.en:
50-year old Carolina comes from Managua and is a single mother with 4 children. She works in business selling cosmetics and thanks to the support which MiCredito and Kiva have given her she has been able to increase her stock and satisfy the needs of her customers.

She is asking for this new loan to buy rings, bracelets, chains, perfumes, creams, make-up and other items, with the aim of increasing her clientele and adding variety to her business. She thinks that on receiving the loan she will be able to improve her premises and thereby increase her income through selling her products. She considers herself to be a self-sufficient person with the ability to carry on running her business independently.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains, perfumes, creams, make-up and other items.

loans.name: Charles Abugo

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old married father of three children. He resides in Yei town, South Sudan. He heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by loan officers. He is a businessmen who owns a boutique in Yei town. The boutique sells new clothes which includes suits, trousers, skirts and blouses. His main business challenge is the unstable currency rate.
Charles is borrowing 3,000 South Sudanese pounds to enable him to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy clothes like suits, trousers, blouses, skirts and coats.

loans.name: Moses Scopas

texts.en:
Moses is a Finance Sudan Limited client. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is a 35-year-old married father of four children. All of his children go to school. 

Moses is a businessman who runs a boutique that sells men's and women's clothes. He has a dream of transforming his business into a big supermarket boutique. He is borrowing 4,000 South Sudanese pounds to enable him buy more clothes for resell. He knows that his children will benefit greatly from this loan as far as tuition fees in school are concerned.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell to men and women

loans.name: Mogga John

texts.en:
John is a 50-year-old man married with five children, two in school. He heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by the loan officers. He is a businessman who has a retail shop in Yei town, South Sudan. He has been doing this business for the past five years. He business involves selling items like soaps, sugar, soda and rice, among many other goods.

John is borrowing 3,000 South Sudanese pounds to buy more stock for his shop. This loan will also enable him to pay school fees and medical fees for his family.

loans.use: To buy items like soaps, sugar, soda and rice for his retail shop.

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es: La joven Sugey tiene 29 años de edad, estudia la carrera de Licenciatura en contabilidad Pública, labora como oficial de presupuesto para una institución del estado devengando el salario mínimo. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación de su carrera. Con su titulo podrá aspirar a otro cargo con mayor remuneración salarial que le permita apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Sugey is 29 years old and is studying for a degree in Public Accountancy. She works as a budget officer for a State institution, earning the minimum salary. She is asking for the loan to pay for her degree course. With her degree she will be able to aim for a different position with a better salary which will allow her to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: Marcos tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Marcos is 44 years old and lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who supports his family with the effort of his work. His economic activity is agriculture and he cultivates wheat, barley, potatoes, root vegetables, vegetables and other products. Since he is a responsible person he was invited to participate in the "Apu Asangani" communal bank. Given this opportunity, he needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to be very responsible about fulfilling the payment of his monthly instalments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rafee

texts.en:
Rafee is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  He is a very hard-working carpenter who learned his skills from his father and opened his own shop in 2000. His skills in making doors, bedroom furniture, and living room furniture increased the demand for his products and he hired one employee to help him keep up with the high demand and commitment to deliver on time. 

Rafee is is requesting a youth loan, which he will use to purchase woods. In the future, he hopes to expand his workplace, buy modern electric machines to maintain the quality of his products, and increase his income in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase woods.

loans.name: Mushtaq

texts.en:
Mushtaq is 37 years old and married, the father of three children.  He has a mini-market. 

His son Ahmed is a student in primary school and gets high grades in school every year.  The family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year for the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books. With this loan, now Mushtag can accommodate all these expenses. 

Mushtaq is requesting a loan to pay for his son's school fees and other study expenses.  Ahmed's dream is to become a dentist. This loan will give a chance to continue his studies and hopefully fulfill that dream.

The story of Ahmed is just one of the many examples of clients of Izdiharona for Economic Development who are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Rinelda Marlene

texts.en:
Working in biotechnology has always been Rinelda's dream. To achieve her goal, Rinelda has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés. She plans on graduating in January 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Rinelda plans on using the loan funds to pay her tuition while she saves her salary from her part-time job. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Rinelda currently works 30 hours a week as a laboratory assistant. With a career in science, she expects to earn $73 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

With one older sibling, Rinelda is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia dreams of working in business administration. She was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Patricia shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Patricia plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees.Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Patricia currently works 40 hours a week as a secretary and earns $10 a day. With a career in business, she expects to earn $13 a day. 

With five older siblings attending college already, Patricia is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Patricia is married with her own child. With a professional degree and a career in business, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 58-year-old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 16 and 30. Her husband works as a farmer to support their family.

Anastacia is also engaged in farming to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 20 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase its profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Hilaria

texts.es:
María Hilaria es una mujer de 50 años con un grado de educación primaria incompleta cursado hasta el tercer grado, madre soltera de 3 hijos la cual se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 10 años siendo sus hijos los únicos que se involucran en las diferentes actividades del campo. Ella también elabora tamales para venta ya que por medio de ello ella pueda generar más ingresos para su hogar. Ella también en ocasiones cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijol pero para consumo y en ocasiones lo vende con los amigos y vecinos de la zona. La tierra que trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia que le dio sus padres la cual está ubicada muy cerca de su casa aproximada mente a 5 minutos a la cual se traslada a pie para dar asistencia a sus cultivos.

Sus planes y sueños a futuro son los de poder comprar más tierra para poder expandir sus cultivos, formar un patrimonio en compañía de sus hijos solido que ayude a mejorar a cada uno la economía en cada uno de sus hogares, teniendo una tierra para trabajar y enfrentar los diferentes problemas financieros de manera favorable. Ella está solicitando a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, herbicidas, fungicidas y semilla de papa certificada para poder cultivar y dar asistencia y mantenimiento
texts.en:
María Hilaria is a 50 year old woman with an incomplete elementary school education, third grade.  She is the single mother of three and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Her children are the only ones involved in the different field activities.  She also makes tamales to sell and she is able to generate more income this way.  At times she also raises basic grains such as corn and beans for personal consumption, but on occasion also sells to her friends and neighbors in the area.  She owns the land she works on, thanks to an inheritance, and it’s located about five minutes from her home, so she walks to work on her crops. 
 
Her plans and dreams are to be able to buy more land  to expand her crops, work with her children to improve each one of their financial situations, have some land to work, and face financial problems in a favorable way.  She is asking for a loan through COMIXMUL so she can buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, seedlings, herbicides, fungicides, and potato seeds, that she can raise and maintain.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Juana Vosco

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 35 años de edad es agricultora y madre de 2 hijas las cuales la mayor está en la primaria y la otra pasa en casa ya que solo tiene un año de edad. Con un grado de educación de primaria incompleto cursado hasta el segundo grado doña Juana junto a su pareja se dedican a la agricultura desde que se casaron siendo su negocio el cultivo, siembra de café, maíz y frijol. Doña Juana tiene 15 años de dedicarse a este tipo de rubro el cual aprendió gracias a sus padres que desde pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo esta la única actividad económica de su familia. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto con calidad, higiene y con un precio competitivo en el mercado local y nacional. Su mayor desafío es combatir las diferentes plagas que puedan dañar sus cultivos ya que una parte está en el solar de su casa de habitación y la otra parte está a una distancia de 1 kilómetro al cual se trasladan a pie ya que no tienen ningún medio de transporte.

Sus planes son seguir luchando para su familia sacar a sus hijos adelante y que no pasen por lo que ella en su juventud apoyarlos en sus estudios para que sean personas preparadas en la vida, con conocimiento y madurez en lo que el día de mañana puedan realizar. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder asistir personalizada mente sus cultivos y prepararlos para las próximas cosechas.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old, a farmer, and the mother of two daughters, the eldest of whom is in primary school.  The other daughter stays home, as she is only a year old.

With an incomplete primary education, having gone as far the second grade, Juana and her partner have been farming since they were married. They grow crops, planting coffee, corn and beans.
