Juana has been in this line of work for 15 years, which she learned thanks to her parents, who taught her to work the land from an early age. This is her family's sole livelihood. 

Her customers are the various middlemen who come to the area in search of a good product with quality, hygiene and priced competitively in the local and national market. Her greatest challenge is combating the various pests that can damage her crops, as part of her plantings are on a piece of land at her home and the other is one kilometer away, where they travel on foot as they don't have any means of transportation. 

Her plans are to continue striving for her family, to raise her children; and so that they don't have to go through what she did in her youth, to help them in their education so that they can be well-qualified people with knowledge and maturity for what they may do in the future.

This is why she has now requested a loan to purchase agricultural supplies, so that she can take personal care of her crops and get them ready for the coming harvests.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
A  senhora Rita é educadora infantil num centro de acolhimento de crianças orfas e tem 3 filhos dos quais apenas 1 estuda os restantes 2  ja são maiores de idade. Ela é viúva e tem 42 anos de idade.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar capulanas para revender aos seus colegas de trabalho por encomendas e pagam no final do mês.
No futro planeia fazer muro de vedação de sua casa e ampliar a mesma.Diz gostar dos servicos oferecidos e que ira pagar pontualmente.
No futuro ira pedir mais credito para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Rita teaches children in a center that shelters orphaned children. She has three children, only one of whom goes to school. The other two children are already adults. She's 42 years old and a widow.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase traditional skirts. She'll re-sell them to her co-workers by order and they'll pay at the end of the month.
In the future she plans to build a surrounding wall around her house and enlarge her house. She states that she likes the services provided and that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion.
In the future she'll request more loans so she can achieve her plans.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.pt:
Sérgio, casado, pai de 2 filhos, um que frequenta escola e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também os seus cinco irmãos que vivem com ele. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de nove anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 25.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos aumentar o volume do negócio e adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o transporte da mercadoria. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Sérgio is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family, he also supports his five siblings who live with him.
He has been a vendor (he sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over nine years.
With the current loan for 25,000mt he intends to purchase more merchandise so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dreams are to increase turnover in his business and acquire a vehicle to make it easier for him to transport the merchandise. His main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise so he can meet the demand by stocking up.

loans.name: Lonnie

texts.en:
Lonnie has more than 20 years of experience in the catering and delivery service business.  In his hometown of New Orleans, Lonnie is hired to cater many special events.  He has only been in business less than six months, but already has seen exponential growth with the help from Accion Texas, Inc. 

In order to continue booking local events, Lonnie needed funds for start-up capital and part-time salaries.  A friend of Lonnie’s told him about Accion and how it could help his business. Once Lonnie inquired and applied for a microloan, it was a short turnaround to receive an approval. 
 
The Accion loan allowed Lonnie to pay his four part-time employees, purchase supplies and food, and have start-up capital for his new business. Without the loan, Lonnie’s business plans would have changed.  The Accion loan allowed expansion plans to continue on track and hire additional staff.

Thanks to the loan, Lonnie says his business will grow faster than he imagined. Lonnie is excited about the growth and looks forward to securing more events and offering his exceptional catering services.

loans.use: to pay his four part-time employees, purchase supplies and food, and have start-up capital for his business.

loans.name: Úrsulo

texts.es: Con un crédito que obtuvo gracias a Kiva surante el año pasado Úrsulo pudo convertir una parte de su siembra a café orgánico, aunque aun no ha terminado por completo y por esta razón este año nuevamente solicita otro crédito para poder continuar con su proyecto para convertir en su totalidad tod su siembra a café orgánico. Además de producir café Úrsulo se dedica a la venta de carne que es otra de sus principales actividades económicas.
texts.en: Úrsulo was able to convert part of his coffee crops to organic last year with a loan he obtained thanks to Kiva, but he hasn't completely finished yet, which is why this year he is requesting another loan in order to continue with his project of converting his whole coffee plantation to organic. In addition to producing coffee, Úrsulo sells meat as another one of his principle economic activities

loans.use: to convert his coffee production from conventional to organic.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 48 years old, married, and has four children.  She is from the town of Getafe, Bohol.  Her husband is a fisherman and works hard to support their family. Anecita helps with the business by selling the fish her husband catches, which she has been doing for three years. 

Anecita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fishing net and pay for boat repair.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and pay for boat repair

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 38 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. She is married, with three children, ages 7 to 12. Her husband works as a driller to support their family.

Arlyn is engaged in rice farming and as a dealer of furniture and furniture accessories to help augment the income of their household. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and paint for her farm.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase its profitability for her children’s education. She also dreams of having other business options to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and paint for her farm

loans.name: Qasim

texts.en:
Qasim is 36 years old.  He has a tent rental shop for weddings and funeral services. He is married and has one child. 

Qasim has a smart boy named Hussien.  Since his work is seasonal, Qasim always worries about making enough money and saving some of it for his son’s school expenses. Every year Qasim faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the school year for the additional expenses to cover school fees, uniforms, and books. With this loan now, Qasim can accommodate all these expenses.

He is requesting a loan to pay his son's tuition fees and other school expenses. Hussien admires his father and how hard he works to keep him in school. 

The story of Hussien, who would like to become a pilot, is just one of many examples of clients of Izdiharona for Economic Development who are able to get a better education.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a television and a DVD player.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Luís, casado, pai de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua irmã, prima e cunhada que vivem com ele. 
É Técnico electrónico (dedica-se a reparação de aparelhos audiovisuais) há mais de dezasseis anos. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais acessórios de audiovisuais para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos abrir um serviço de grande dimensão e melhorar as condições da sua habitação. O principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Luís is married and has four children, three of whom attend different grades of school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family, he also supports his sister, cousin and sister-in-law who live with him.
He has been an electronics technician (he repairs audio-visual equipment) for over 16 years.
With the current loan for 10,000mt he intends to purchase more audio-visual accessories so he can meet the demand by stocking up.
His dreams are to open a large scale business and improve his living conditions. His main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more audio-visual accessories so he can meet the demand by stocking up.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
To Larisa, it seems like dance has always been a part of her life. However, it was not an easy path. Born with severely clubbed feet, she wore casts on her legs for the first nine months of her life. Her doctors doubted whether she would ever walk normally, but Larisa had other plans! At 18 months, she took her first steps, and at age five, Larisa turned to dance to strengthen her feet. She struggled with ankle pain throughout childhood, but she kept on dancing, stricken with what she calls “the fever”! 

Larisa continued dancing and won numerous competitions. She recalls dancing in the 2001 Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade, as part of the Tap Dancing Christmas Trees, just two months after September 11. “It was surreal being in New York at that time,” she shared. Dancing helped build Larisa’s self-confidence and gave her a sense of pride.  Her experiences motivated her to help others overcome their obstacles and to experience the joy of dance. 

In her 20’s, Larisa moved to San Diego and was determined to set up a dance studio. She then researched local dance studies and realized that there were few tap dance opportunities in San Diego. As a result, in 2008, she opened Tap Fever Studios, a non-profit dance school with a focus on tap. Tap Fever’s mission is building self-esteem, athleticism and giving back to the community. Classes include tap, jazz, ballet, contemporary, hip-hop and partner dancing. Tap Fever provides accessible classes for people with disabilities, dance scholarships and mentoring for teens. 

The summer months are typically the slowest times for dance studios, as people go on vacations. To help stabilize cash flows during the summer months, Larisa turned to her bank for a loan, but was unable to qualify for a traditional loan. Her banker suggested that she apply for a Kiva loan through Accion San Diego, a microfinance lender. 

A Kiva loan of $5,000 helps pay the studio’s rent and utilities for the summer months and ensures that Tap Fever’s programs continue to give people of all ages, backgrounds, physical abilities and incomes the opportunity to experience the joy of dance. 

“It is so rewarding to see the joy of students who are visually impaired, on crutches or others who just want to get healthier,” she shared. 

For more information on Tap Fever Studios and its mission, go to www.TapFever.com.

loans.use: to pay for her studio's rent and utilities

loans.name: Raul

texts.en: Raul wants to work in business administration. To achieve this goal, Raul is currently attending the Universidad San Francisco Xavier, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in December 2013, but, without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Raul plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Raul feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Raul currently works 30 hours a week as a sales manager and earns $7 a day. With a degree in business, he expects to earn $14 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Raul is unsure how he would be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Yhoanna Esdenka

texts.en:
Yhoanna dreams of becoming a professional. Yhoanna is currently attending the Universidad San Francisco Xavier working towards a degree in agronomy. She expects to graduate in March 2014 but, without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Yhoanna shares that it is important to her to graduate on time, so she can enter the job market as soon as possible.

Yhoanna plans on using this loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in agronomy before graduating.

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Yhoanna currently works 30 hours a week and earns $12 a day. With a degree in agronomy, she expects to earn $19 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Yhoanna is unsure how she would be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en:
Roxana has always dreamt of becoming a lawyer. To achieve her goal, Roxana has enrolled in the Universidad Salesiana De Bolivia. She expects to graduate in December, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Roxana shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Roxana plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in law before graduating. Roxana currently works 30 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in law, she expects to earn $30 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

As the youngest of eight, with three older siblings attending college already, Roxana is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Roxana's father works as a landlord, and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Katherine Rosmery

texts.en:
Katherine dreams of working in the tourism industry, but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. To achieve her goal, Katherine has enrolled in the Universidad Autonoma de Pando. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

With a loan, Katherine plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. In Bolivia, it is very common to have fees for earning your title before graduating.  Unfortunately, Katherine's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. 

Growing up, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Katherine is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his graduation fees.

loans.name: Santos Ruben

texts.en:
Becoming a veterinarian has always been Santos' dream. To achieve his goal, Santos has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. He plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Santos plans on using the loan to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Caranavi. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Santos currently works 30 hours a week and earns $15 a day. With a degree in veterinary medicine, he expects to earn $20 a day.

Santos' parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of five, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Santos is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for his graduation fees.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica, de 35 años, está casada con Ardí quien se dedica al transporte, viven en su casa propia junto con su hijo de 09 meses de edad. Mónica se dedica a la venta de lubricantes. Lleva más de  05 años en esta actividad. Comenta que se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de los estudios de su hijo. Realiza esta actividad económica junto a su esposo. Antes de iniciar este negocio no contaba con el capital  para comprar los productos que ofrece a la venta. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará aceites, lubricantes y otros productos para los vehículos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mónica is 35 years old and married to Ardí who is a driver. They live in their own home with their nine-month old son. Mónica sells lubricants. She has been in this business more than five years. 

She says that she started in this business because she needed to generate income to pay for her son's school expenses. She runs this business with her husband. Before starting the business she didn't have the working capital to buy the products she sells.

On this occasion she will request 1000 soles, and she feels grateful for the financial assistance she is receiving to move forward. In addition, she promises to make her installment payments on time. With the amount requested she will buy motor oils, lubricants and other products for her customers' vehicles.

loans.use: To buy motor oils, lubricants and other products.

loans.name: Dúo La Arboleda Group

texts.es:
DUO LA ARBOLEDA
El Señor Alejandro de 64 años, casado. Desde hace 2 años posee una Crianza de Marranos ubicada en La Alameda, Los Aposentos, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio él ha mantenido y a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Don Alejandro es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través de su negocio y atraves de microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE/KIVA; el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de cerdos y alimentos para los mismo para seguir creciendo con su Crianza de Marranos.
texts.en:
DUO LA ARBOLEDA

 Alejandro is 64 years old and married.  He has been raising pigs for two years in  La Alameda, Los Aposentos.  Through his efforts he has managed to establish and improve his house.  Through his business he has maintained his family and gotten them ahead.  

Alejandro's dream is to be able to improve the quality of his life and that of his family.  He dreams of doing this through his business and the microloan he is requesting from FAPE/Kiva.  The loan that he is requesting is to buy pigs and feed for them.  He will do this in order to continue growing with his business of raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 53 años, está casada con Laber y tiene 04 hijos menores de edad con quienes vive en su casa propia. Alicia se dedica a la venta de comida. Realiza esta función en el frontis de su casa en donde ha acondicionado un espacio cómodo para atender a sus clientes. Como todos los días, Alicia sale muy temprano de su hogar y se dirige al mercado en busca de ingredientes e insumos frescos para así poder preparar los deliciosos platillos con los que deleita a sus clientes, su horario laboral se inicia por la tarde ofreciendo a la venta diferentes comidas regionales. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 03 años y durante este tiempo trabaja sola ya que por el momento no considera necesario la ayuda de ningún personal.Le esta yendo muy bien, genera buenas ventas diarias y por tanto tiene buenos ingresos económicos los cuales utiliza para poder cubrir las principales necesidades de sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos al por mayor como arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, tubérculos, huevos y condimentos para continuar preparando los alimentos que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Alicia, 53, is married to Laber and has four minor children living with her in her own house.  Alicia works selling food.  She does so in front of her house where she’s set up a comfortable space for her customers.  

Alicia leaves her house very early every day and heads to the market to find fresh ingredients and supplies to prepare the delicious dishes she pleases her customers with.  Her work day starts in the evening when she sells various regional dishes.  She’s been in business three years and has worked alone all this time because she doesn’t feel the need to hire staff to help at the moment.  She’s doing very well and she generates good daily sales so her income is good and she uses it to cover her children’s main needs.

On this occasion she’s asking for 800 soles.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel sure of being able to make progress in her business.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.

She will use the requested amount to buy supplies and ingredients like rice, sugar, noodles, tubers, eggs and condiments at wholesale to continue making the food she puts up for sale.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Alzira

texts.pt:
Alzira, casada, mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais um é que frequenta escola e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também quatro sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de quinze anos.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos melhorar as condições da sua habitação e aumentar o volume de stock no negócio. Tem como principal desafio a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Alzira is married and has five children, one of whom attends school. She lives in a house that she owns. Aside from her family, she also supports four nephews who live with her.
She has been a vendor (she sells soft drinks, rice, cornflour and other household staples) for over 15 years.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she intends to purchase more merchandise so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to improve her living conditions and bring the stock level up in her business. Her main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise so she can meet the demand by stocking up.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Desde pequeño Dionisio aprendió todo lo relacionado con el café al lade de su padre y cuando se casó y formó su propia familia se independizó. Siempre se ha preocupado por producir café de excelente calidad y hace unos meses resembró una parte de su terreno para que dentro de 3 años su producción de café aumente. Para que esto sea posible es necesario realizar algunos trabajos en su finca como limpieza, poda y fertilizar y por eso necesita un crédito de Kiva para poder pagar todos esos trabajos. Con las ganancias que obtenga al final de la cosecha y una vez que haya pagado su crédito, Dionisio comenzará con un proyecto de realizar un vivero de planta de café para que en los próximos años la pueda sembrar en su parcela.
texts.en:
As a child, Dionisio learned everything related to coffee from his father. When he got married and formed his own family, he became independent. He has always focused on producing coffee of excellent quality. A few months ago, Dionisio replanted part of his land so that in three years’ time his coffee production will increase.  In order for this to be possible, some necessary tasks like weeding, pruning and fertilizing, must take place and he needs a Kiva loan to be able to pay for this work.

With profits earned at the end of the harvest and once he’s repaid the loan, Dionisio will start a project: a coffee seedling nursery so that he will be able to plant his parcel in upcoming years.

loans.use: to weed, prune and fertilize his farm.

loans.name: Mirtha Miriada

texts.en:
Mirtha has always dreamt of becoming a professional. To achieve her goal, Mirtha has enrolled in the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés. She plans on graduating in March, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Mirtha plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Mirtha currently works 30 hours a week as a legal assistant and earns $9 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $34 a day. 

Mirtha's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of four, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings already attending college, Mirtha is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Mirtha's father's salary from his job as a landlord is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Tayna Adela

texts.en:
Tayna has always dreamt of becoming a lawyer. She was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

With a loan, Tayna plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in law before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Tayna currently works 30 hours a week and earns $5 a day. With a career in law, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

As the youngest of five, with one older sibling attending college already, Tayna is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Katherin Amparo

texts.en:
Becoming a dentist has always been Katherin's dream. She is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés, working towards her degree in dentistry. She plans on graduating in December 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Katherin plans on spending the loan towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Katherin hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

Katherin currently works 40 hours a week as a cashier in a store and earns $12 a day. With a degree in dentistry, she expects to earn $73 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Katherin is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Las  Violetas Group

texts.es:
Las Violetas es un grupo integrado por 4 mujeres amables, emprendedoras y alegres, este grupo se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocido como la novia del sol por sus fuertes calores en verano, en este lugar las principales actividades económicas son el comercio y la ganadería. 

Angélica es una de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 41 años de edad, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada, ella tiene dos hijas, y platica que desde hace 25 años se ha dedicado al comercio y actualmente junto a su esposo ha puesto una zapateria en el centro de su municipio, ella esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que por varios años ha sido una fuente de empleo para su familia ademas que ha ayudado a dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y sus hijas por las tardes la ayudan a atenderlo y les enseña a trabajar para ganarse la vida, ella dice que lo que hace diferente a su zapateria de otras son los precios y que siempre tiene variedad de zapatos de moda. ella espera invertir este crédito en la compra variedad de calzado para continuar con sus ventas y resurtir su negocio.
ella espera que su negocio continué progresando y dando mejores ganancias ya que quiere que sus hijas tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.  

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Monica con venta de ropa 
Anselma molino de nixtamal
Martha venta de ropa
texts.en:
Las Violetas is a group of four friendly, enterprising, and happy women.  The bank's located in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as "The Girlfriend of the Sun" for its intense summer heat.  The main economic activities here are commerce and ranching.

Angélica, 41, is one of the members of the group.  She's married and has two children, and she only attended elementary school.  She says she has been a merchant for 25 years.

Currently Angélica and her husband have set up a shoe store in the center of town.  She's very happy with her business because for several years it has been a source of income for her family.  Also, it has helped her give her family a better quality of life.  In the afternoon her daughters help her tend to the store and she teaches them to earn a living.  She says her prices and the variety of stylish shoes distinguish her shoe store from others.

Angélica hopes to invest this loan in buying a variety of footwear to restock her business and continue with her sales.  She hopes her business continues to make progress and earn better profits because she wants her children to be able to study for a profession.

The other members of the group are Mónica, who sells clothing; Anselma, who has a nixtamal mill; and Martha, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Arabella

texts.en:
Arabella is a 25-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest child is eight, while the youngest is one. She is engaged in fishing and sells fish. She has been involved in fishing for more than five years. 

Arabella requested a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy wood, nails, and cement and to pay for labor to renovate her house, so it will be more comfortable to live in for her family. 

In the future, Arabella would like to expand her fishing business to support her family with good food and provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and cement and to pay for labor to renovate her house.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a 37-year-old married woman living in the town of Talibon in Bohol, Philippines. She has two children, ages three and eleven. 

Arlyn runs a motorcycle business and has had this business for a long time now. This business provides them the income that they need for food and school fees. Arlyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to buy a spare tire and pay for vulcanizing and other maintenance and repair of their motorcycle. 

In the future, Arlyn hopes to invest in another business to increase their daily income. She also hopes to educate her children until college.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire and pay for vulcanizing and other maintenance and repair.

loans.name: German Maurico

texts.es:
German de 24 años de edad, es una persona acompañada, padre de dos hijos. Estudio hasta educación media.
Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. A quienes enviá a la escuela mientras ellos se dedican a las actividades agrícolas y de jornal.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, desde pequeño y lo cual le genera ingresos además de realizar actividades de jornal

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas, para producir  leche que venderá su compañera de vida, para obtener mejor ingresos para el sustento de la familia.

Uno de sus sueños, es adquirir un terreno para construir su propia casa, ya que actualmente solo están cuidando una propiedad de otra persona.
texts.en:
German is 24 years old, married, and the father of two.  He has a junior high school education.

Every day he gets up at 5:00 am, along with his wife and children.  He sends the children to school while he and his wife work on the farm.

He is a farmer, having learned from his parents when he was young, and it generates income.  He also has another job.

He is asking for this loan to buy two cows to produce milk, which his wife will sell in order to generate more income to support the family.

One of his dreams is to acquire land so he can have a house of his own, since they currently care for someone else’s house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 53 years old, married and has 5 children.  He works as a solar lamp distributor in Mali.

Prior to becoming a distributor for NOTS, Daniel studied agriculture and engineering and worked as a farm manager at a Malian textile company.   Upon learning about the work of NOTS Mali, he was very motivated to become a distributor because he knew solar lamps would be a great benefit to people living in the rural areas where he lived and worked.  

Daniel sells solar lamps directly to farmers and through small retailers and individual entrepreneurs in Sikasso, the southern-most region in Mali.   Most people living in this area work in agriculture and about 80% of the population does not have access to electricity.  They rely, instead, on kerosene, flashlights and candles for light and they must walk long distances and pay to charge their mobile phones.  On top of being harmful to the environment, time-consuming, and damaging to users' health (inhaling kerosene fumes is like smoking 2 packs of cigarettes a day), these energy sources are expensive, costing a family at least $80 per year.   

A solar lamp has a lifetime of about 5 years and costs $25.  Purchasing a solar lamp is a win-win-- families benefit because they save time and money and they are safer and healthier and the environment benefits from less toxic waste and reduced CO2 emissions caused by kerosene use. 

The funds from Kiva investors will allow Daniel to purchase solar lamps and sell them to cotton and sesame farmers on credit.  These lamps will impact approximately 4,000 lives.  Harvest season starts in September, so it is a good time for Daniel to sell lamps as the farmers will have some money to pay for the lamps.  It is difficult, however, for them to pay in one lump-sum payment, so Daniel will collect payments in installments.  This way farmers can access solar light without so much financial strain on their household.

loans.use: To buy solar lamps that he will sell to cotton and sesame farmers.

loans.name: Tarbiya

texts.en:
Tarbiya is 57 years old.She is married and she has 6 beautiful kids. Tarbiya raises fruits and vegetables in her garden and has been doing this for the last  18 years. She is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of the land and how to work it. 

Tarbiya usually grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes, dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers, and tomatoes. Tarbiya 's monthly income from this business is 120 AZN. This is only one source of income in her family.

Now, she would like to invest more capital in her business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. She hopes this loan will improve life for her family.

loans.use: to invest more capital in her business and purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Amélia, solteira, mãe de 3 filhos, dos quais 2 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa cedida. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua sobrinha e seu irmão que vivem com ela. 
É comerciante (vende vestuário e carne de perú) há mais de dois anos. Também é funcionária pública, a sua tia apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais carne de perú e vestuário para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonhos melhorar seu negócio, construir uma casa condigna e aumentar o nível académico. Tem como principais desafios: a falta de fundos para investir no negócio, na habitação e o pagamento de propinas escolares.
texts.en:
Amélia is single and has three children, two of whom attend different grades of school. She lives in a house provided by her employer. Aside from her family, she also supports her niece and her brother who live with her.
She has been a vendor (she sells clothing and turkey meat) for over two years. She's also a civil servant. She gets help from her aunt in her business.
With the current loan for 10,000mt she intends to purchase more clothing and turkey meat so she can meet the demand by stocking up.
Her dreams are to improve her business, build a decent house and enhance her education level. Her main challenges are: the lack of funds for investing in her business and in her housing situation and paying for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and turkey meat so she can meet the demand by stocking up.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
An activist for differently-abled citizens, Jose represents individuals who make claims for Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI) benefits and mostly works with the San Antonio AIDS Foundation.  Jose’s future plans are to work with similar nonprofit agencies.

In 2011, SSDI accounted for the income of 9.8 million people in the United States, giving them a chance earn a living with their physical limitations.  As of July 2013, 54,273 Americans benefited from SSI.  It is through Jose’s business, Gaucin Disability Advocacy, that qualifying citizens in San Antonio and its surrounding areas are able to receive the complete amount they are due since they are unable to work.

Jose says Gaucin Disability Advocacy offers representation, a service not available at any other law firm. Within his business, Jose offers “respect to beneficiaries and so many deserving members of our community, and (my) experience to win disabled claims in a timely fashion.”

If ever in doubt about the process of his business, Jose says the Social Security Administration offers technical advice and assistance online, through the phone, or in person.  This ensures that Gaucin Disability Advocacy is complying with Federal procedures. 

Though Jose has seven years’ experience working for the Social Security Administration, he recognized his weakness in marketing his business within his hometown.  Needing to strengthen his weakness, Jose searched for a business loan.  After learning of nonprofit microlender Accion Texas, Inc., he applied for a loan to ramp up his marketing abilities. With his loan, Jose was able to develop an image for his business and better advertise his services.

“I am passionate towards helping the disabled in their needs,” Jose says.  He has the ability to help the 26,490 disabled citizens in Bexar country.  A loan of $25 to Jose will help him help others.

loans.use: to market his advocacy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Rubilita

texts.en:
Rubilita is 43 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol. Rubilita is engaged in fishing together with her husband. She also operates a sari-sari (general) store to earn extra income. 

Rubilita  is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a new engine for their boat. She hopes that this loan will improve the income for her family when they have a good catch.  In the future, she hopes to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

loans.name: Máxima Margarita

texts.es:
Máxima de 31 años de edad,  estudio hasta educación media y es madre soltera de un hijo de tres años. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m.  Se dedica al comercio de ropa, hamacas, etc. Ademas de vender pupusas los fines de semana, oficios que aprendió de su madre, para comercializarla  lo hace en el lugar donde reside y en los cantones aledaños y municipios

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas mercadería como ropa e insumos para elaborar las pupusas,  ya que lo que invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su hijo

ella pretende en un futuro, comprar un terreno y poder hacer su casa; ya que actualmente vive junto con sus  familiares.
texts.en:
Máxima, 31, completed secondary education and is a single mother of a three-year-old son.  She rises at 4:30am and works selling clothes, hammocks, etc.  She also sells ‘pupusas’ [grilled, filled corn cakes] on the weekend.  She learned these occupations from her mother.  She sells at home and in adjacent cantons and towns.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy more merchandise like clothes and ingredients to make pupusas because what she invests is insufficient.  She uses income earned to provide sustenance for her son.  She intends in future to buy a piece of land to build her house since she’s currently living with relatives.

loans.use: to buy clothes and ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in Colquepata district in Paucartambo province. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is helping his family get ahead in life through his work effort. His business is agriculture and he grows wheat, barley, potatoes, tubers, vegetables and other crops. 

He is a responsible person, and for that reason has been invited to participate in the "Apu Asangani" communal bank. On this occasion he needs the loan to buy seeds. He is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to be very responsible in making his monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Zamik

texts.en:
Zamik is a 32 year-old man. He is married and has two sons. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place in a central bazaar and from his home. With the help of Aqroinvest Credit Union, Zamik  was able to start his own business. He has eight years of experience. The reason he started his business was due to his poor living conditions and small pension. 

Fruits are very popular among the Azerbaijan people and are in high demand during the year. People like to eat them fresh, and this is one of the main desserts for guests. His shop is located in the center bazaar, and people always pass his shop and buy some fresh fruits. His monthly income from this business is 190 AZN. Zamik 's wife helps him to sell fruits.

Zamik wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables to increase his turnover as well as improve the living conditions of his family. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,800 AZN loan. This will be his second loan, and Zamik has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.en:
Baltazara is 49 years old and comes from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has one child. For quite some time now, she has been in the business of selling home-cooked meals and selling clothes for an income.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, like vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, vegetables and meat. The loan will also provide hope for her planned business expansion and sustainability.

She dreams of making the most out of her business, so she can give her family a comfortable life and also save for the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for home-cooked meals, like vegetables, meat and cooking oil

loans.name: Dúo Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Dúo Sagrado Corazón de Jesus
Este dúo está conformado por doña Verónica Julissa, ella tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de panes, pastelitos, café, café con leche, en su panadería, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de un aparato para hacer capuchino su deseo es seguir surtiendo su panadería y servir mejor a sus clientes, y sobre todo darle mejor calidad de vida a su hija, y a su familia de la misma manera doña, Vilma Judith, ella tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de medicamentos,ellas esperan que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado y les agradecen al mismo tiempo por su ayuda en su negocio que Dios los bendiga endonde quiera que esten.
texts.en:
Sacred Heart of Jesus Duo

Verónica Julissa, 30, is part of this duo.   She works selling bread rolls, cakes, coffee and coffee with milk in her bakery.  She’s requesting the loan to buy a machine to make cappuccino.  Her wish is to continue stocking her bakery to better serve her customers and above all to provide better quality of life for her daughter and for her family.

Vilma Judith, 29, sells medicine.  They are hoping that they will be helped with the loan they are requesting and are grateful for your help in their business.  May God bless you wherever you are.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Virgen Maria De Inquilpata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariela ella es casada y tiene 33 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría las gallinas y cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de queso, la socia vende los quesos a diferentes personas, por medio de estos pequeño negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas y cuyes.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen María de Inquilpata communal bank.  This bank is in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department.

María, age 33 , is married and has one child.  She works in the business of selling and raising animals.   She raises chickens and guinea pigs.  She fattens them and makes them grow.  She sells them at the different fairs.  

She also sells cheese to different people through these small businesses.  She gets her children ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell the chickens and guinea pigs.  She is requesting the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

The inset photo was taken later.  The members asked permission due to work.

The other members have businesses selling clothes, "chicha" (a corn based drink), a grocery store, and farming.  The members are grateful to those who form part of this dream through the loan.  They pledge to make their payments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a 38-year-old single mother of four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She runs a boutique where she mainly sells women clothes and the business is very lucrative. 

As the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University. The ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth while her desire is to set up two more boutiques in different towns.

Enid intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is a 34-year-old woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 11. She started a fishing business ten years ago, so that she could help support her family. She works with her husband, and this is their main source of livelihood.

She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy plywood for boat repair, and pay for engine. Once these materials are available, she can be assured of better productivity in her business. Her income will provide food and school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have another business so that she can increase her profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy plywood for boat repair, and pay for engine

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don Francisco es originario de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 55 años de edad, casado, padre de 2  hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de celulares hace mas de 3 años. Inicio esta actividad comprando celulares nuevos por unidad, lo cual ha sido rentable hasta la actualidad, distribuye sus productos de manera ambulante en los mercados de la capital y departamentos junto al apoyo de su esposa. Está agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que logro invertir en su negocio y adquirir mayores ingresos. Su expectativa es aumentar su inventario y abastecer a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar celulares al por mayor. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para prosperar exitosamente en su negocio. Su meta próxima es obtener un tramo el mercado para comercializar sus productos de manera estable.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the city of Managua.  He’s 55-years-old, married and father of two children.  He’s a merchant by profession and has been selling cell phones for more than three years.  He started this activity buying new cell phones by the unit which has been profitable to date.  He sells his goods from place to place in markets in the capital and in departments;  his wife helps him.

He’s grateful to Kiva and to MiCrédito because he managed to invest in his business and earn higher income.  His hope is to increase inventory and supply his customers.  He’s requesting the loan to buy cell phones at wholesale.  He figures the loan will be of much help for him to successfully prosper in his business.  His next goal is to obtain space in the market to sell his goods in a stable way.

loans.use: to buy cell phones at wholesale.

loans.name: Honest

texts.en:
Honest is a new client, married to Mbibase Arthur, has two children, and residing in rural Ntungamo district. She attended school up to form four thereafter, she joined a training in Nursing. But because of the little salary she earns at the end of the month, she decided to approach UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to increase her earnings and the well being of her family. 

She is facing the challenge of low production. She applied for loan of ugx.1,000,000 to buy organic fertilizers for her poor banana plantation, of which fertility she intends to improve with the manure. 

Her dream is to become a commercial farmer and buy her own transport van for her business to the market, but she is always limited by capital, and yet she has enough experience in her business. With this loan she thinks that she will improve his banana plantation.
Honest is both a cattle farmer and banana grow, and the picture in the banana plantation was not clear. For this reason, we used one with cows since she does both.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her banana plantation to improve production.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 48 years old and comes from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages 8 - 27. She and her family are engaged in a fishing business, for an income.  Her business has been in existence for 8 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net. She is determined to make sure that her child gets a good education out of her income. She would like to continue her business, so she can provide well for her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, a 23-year-old woman with three children, ages one month, five and six. She is married to a fisherman. Jean helps her husband by selling his catch and also buys fish to sell. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for the fishing boat, like plywood and hard wood.

Jean would be more confident with their livelihood if they could have a new fishing boat to use. She hopes to increase her income, and to be able to make improvements to their house out of her profit, someday. In the future, it is her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for the fishing boat, like plywood and hard wood

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 63 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
63-year old Francisca lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in Colquepata district, Paucartambo province. She is a hardworking enterprising person who helps her family get ahead through her efforts. She earns her living growing wheat, barley, potatoes, tubers, and vegetables etc. 

Francisca is a responsible person which is why she was invited to join the Apu Asangani Community Bank. She would now like a loan to buy fertilizer and manure. She is grateful for this valuable assistance and promises to make the monthly repayments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 33 años, vive junto  a su pareja Teodoro y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de 2 hectáreas los cuales logró adquirir desde muy joven con ayuda de su esposo. En sus terrenos posee diversas plantaciones de cacao orgánico, café, barbasco y árboles frutales.
Cuenta con el firme apoyo de su pareja y en ocasiones con el de sus hijos en actividades menores.
Su labor principal consiste en brindarle el mejor de los cuidados a sus distintas plantaciones para obtener una buena calidad de frutos al finalizar la campaña productiva y llevarlos hasta los centro de venta de su localidad. Su producto preferido entre las plantaciones que posee es el cacao orgánico debido al buen precio que recibe por sus ventas ya que es un producto muy rentable. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 4,000 nuevos soles para la compra de una pequeño terreno para ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Margarita, 33, lives with her spouse, Teodoro, and their four children in her own house.  She’s worked in agriculture for the last ten years on her 2 hectares of land that she acquired when still very young with her husband’s help.  She grows organic cacao beans, coffee, barbasco [an evergreen bush] and fruit trees on her and.  Her husband is her staunch supporter and sometimes her children help out with the less strenuous chores.

Her main work consists in providing the best possible care for her various crops in order to obtain good quality fruit at the end of the growing cycle and then take them to her local sales center.  Her favorite product among the ones she produces is the organic cacao because of the good sales price it commands; it’s a very profitable product.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s gotten to continue moving forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  

On this occasion she needs to have 4,000 new soles to buy a small parcel of land to expand her cocoa bean crop.

loans.use: to buy a small parcel of farmland.

loans.name: Santos Justiniano

texts.es: Don Santos es originario de la ciudad Managua. Tiene 54 años de edad, soltero, padre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a  la comercialización de queso y cuajada, desde hace 12 años. Está agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito, ya que pudo invertir en productos que necesitaba para sus clientes, logrando adquirir mayor clientela y  estabilidad en su familia. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar queso, crema y cuajada al por mayor, con el fin de obtener bajos precios en la comprar de dichos productos. Una vez cancelado el pago del crédito seguirá trabajando para obtener otro y terminar de cumplir sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Santos is from the city of Managua.  He’s 54-years-old, single and father of three children.  He’s a merchant by profession.  He’s worked for the last 12 years selling cheese and curd.  He’s grateful to Kiva and MiCredito because he was able to buy the products he needed for his customers thus acquiring more customers and stability for his family.

He’s asking for a new loan to buy cheese, cream and curd at wholesale aiming at getting the lowest prices when he purchases these products.  Once he repays the loan he’ll continue working to get another one in order to finish reaching his future  goals.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream and curd at wholesale.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
Pauline is 35 years old, a widow and member of Vision Group. She has four children who all attend school. 

Despite the fact that she earns little income, Pauline has managed to provide all the necessities for her family. She sells charcoal to earn a living; she has been in business since 2007, when her husband passed on. Ever since the death of her husband, Pauline has became a very hardworking lady, since no one else was going to provide for her family. 

Pauline got a loan from Ugafode which benefited her in the conservation of the environment by completing her sewage tank. This cycle, she needs a loan to pay school fees for her children, who are now beginning the third term. The remaining balance will be used to stock more bags of charcoal to boost her business. 

Pauline is very honest, hardworking, and social. She thanks Kiva through Ugafode for partnering with them to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Lidio

texts.es:
Lidio tiene de 38 años, es viudo y vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia hecha de material noble. Lidio se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió está actividad gracias a sus padres y cuando cumplió 20 años les pidió a sus padres un apoyo para independizarse ya que estaba decidido a trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida con la esperanza de formar una familia sólida a futuro, no obstante tras tener a su segundo hijo sufrió la irreparable muerte de su esposa quien fue su principal apoyo en las labores que desempeñaba.
Fue así que al tener la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos se inició con mayor motivación esperando a través de su trabajo brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Actualmente posee 2 hectáreas de cultivo con diversas plantaciones de cacao, café y otros productos de pan llevar.
Su labor consiste en brindarle un cuidado y mantenimiento adecuado a sus terrenos evitando el ataque de plagas y fertilizando sus terrenos con abono orgánico. Su principal objetivo es reunir el dinero suficiente para enviar a sus hijos a otra ciudad en donde la educación es mucho mejor. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Lidio, age 38, is a widower.  He lives with his two children in his own house made of sturdy materials.  Lidio is a farmer.  He learned this business activity thanks to his parents.  When he turned 20, he asked his parents for some support to become independent.  He had decided to work and to improve his quality of life.  He did this in the hope of forming a solid family in the future.  However, after having his second child, he suffered the irreparable loss of his wife.  She was his main support in the work that he did.

That is why he has the responsibility for looking after his two children.  He started with greater motivation hoping to, through his work, provide them with a good quality of life. 

He currently has two hectares of land with diverse crops of cacao, coffee, and other products to bring home the daily bread. 

His work consists of providing care and adequate maintenance to his land.  He needs to avoid past infestations, and he needs to fertilize his land with organic fertilizer.  His main objective is to get together enough money to send his children to another city where they can get a better education.  

This is his second loan with Kiva.  He is grateful for the financial support is receiving in order to get ahead.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He now wishes to have 3,500 soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is married and has five children, and all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. 

Winnie sells charcoal at the market, on both a wholesale and a retail basis. She has been in business for eight years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season), which hinders her movements, and the ever-increasing price of charcoal.

She aspires to get a delivery van, and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la agricultura entonces cultivas verduras como habas, zanahoria, arvejas, papa, repollos, brócoli y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Leandro is 43 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba in Paucartambo Province.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who helps his family get ahead.  Through his work efforts, he manages an agriculture business in which he grows vegetables such as beans, carrots, peas, potatoes, cabbages, broccoli, and other produce. Leandro is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. He appreciates and values this loan, so he promises to complete his monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix tiene 51 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura y la ganadería pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y para pagar a los ayudantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Félix, 51, lives in the community of Chicchicmarca in Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province.  He’s a hardworking, enterprising man who supports his family with his effort and work.  His main economic activity is agriculture and animal husbandry.  He has several parcels of land where he grows wheat, barley, potatoes, tubers, vegetables and others.  He’s a responsible person which is why he was invited to participate in the “Apu Asangani” communal bank and on this occasion he needs the loan to buy seed and to pay helpers.  He values and is grateful for the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay helpers.

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benecia ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ovejas, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Apu Curi” communal bank located in Urcos District belonging to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

Benecia, 42, has a spouse and 8 children. She works in her business raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs.  She helps them grow and fattens them up to then sell them in various livestock markets.  She supports her children by means of this small business.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her guinea pigs.  She’s requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.  She thanks all those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.  The other members sell sheep, sell chicha [traditional corn-based beverage], are grocers and work in agriculture.

The members that appear in the photo added to the group photo took their photo later because they asked permission due to work.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 23-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has two children ages one and two. Bernadette has been engaged in fishing and selling fresh fish for 5 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishnet, to replace her old one.

She works hard for her two children and knows that the loan will help make a difference in the life of her kids.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a fishnet

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la comunidad Chicchicmarca en el distrito de Colquepata en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura y la ganadería pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra habas, trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Apu Asangani” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santos, 43, lives in Chicchicmarca in the Colquepata district of Paucartambo province. This hardworking, enterprising man provides for his family by farming and raising livestock. He has several plots of land on which he grows beans, wheat, barley, potatoes, root vegetables, and more. 

Since he is responsible, he was asked to join the communal bank “Apu Asangani.” He has applied for a loan to buy seed. He values and is thankful for the loan and promises to make his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam was born in in 1971. She is married and has one daughter and two sons; one of them is a security guard. Her husband is a governmental employee. 

Khitam has been working in raising goats and selling them for five years. She started her project with raising four goats, then she expanded her project over time. 

She is planning to expand her project more until she reaches hundreds of goats.  That will raise her productivity and help her earn a better income so she can help her husband support their children. 

Khitam wants to buy food for her goats. But she doesn't have enough money for it. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy food for her goats

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo is 25 years old, from the community of Talibon, Bohol. He is married, with a four-year-old daughter. 

Carlo catches fish for an income while his wife takes care of their child. Carlo started fishing three years ago to support his family. 

He is asking for a loan to buy an engine and fish net necessary for his livelihood. 

In the future, Carlo hopes to expand his business and venture into other types of business to maximize his income and send his child to school.

loans.use: to buy an engine and fish net.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 27-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages two to six. Her husband is a fisherman and also catches crab for an income.
 
Julie has been doing the same for the last four years in order to help him in raising their children. She is asking for a loan to buy screening and rope which are necessary to make crab traps. 

In the future, she hopes to expand their fishing business and increase business profitability so she can better support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy screening and rope

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish net, plywood, and gasoline.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is a 34-year-old owner of a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Corazon relies on her business income to support her children, including paying for their school fees and food. She is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to pay for labor for her store expansion. She is determined to make the most out of her business. In the future, she hopes to offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to pay for labor for her store expansion

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 36 years old and married. She has three children aged two to seven. Her husband is a farmer. Helen has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years now. She sells bread, canned goods, eggs and dried fish. She is able to provide for her family’s daily needs with her business. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and rice. Helen would like to successfully expand her business to meet family commitments, like educating her children and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 28-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; two of her children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. Her other two children go to school; it is very difficult for her to provide her children higher education. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide a higher education to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of  a profitable source of income. 

In fact, her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years and he earns as much as their expenses are. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have sufficient funds to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to repair the auto rickshaw body. 

Samina hopes that she would be able to save enough till her children are grown and she would be successful in providing a higher education to her children.

loans.use: For the maintenance of their auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer soltera de 23  años de edad  vive junto a su hijo de 3 años en el Sector Centro, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá.
Ella es  una persona trabajadora que lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos, que son utilizados por las mujeres indígenas de su comunidad. 
Comenta que desde hace 13 años viene realizando esta labor, ya que cuando era pequeña su madre le enseño este oficio, que hasta el momento le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le han ayudado a contribuir en la economía de su familia.
Ahora ella ve la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de hilos de varios colores para la elaboración de los cortes tipicos,  ya que cada día va en  aumento este tipo de negocio.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio, con el propósito de ahorrar para poder construir su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de  vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 23-year old single mother who lives with her 3-year old son in the Sector Centro, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá.

She is a hardworking person who does the best she can to provide for her family. She currently earns her living making the traditional clothing worn by the indigenous women of her community. It's work that she's been doing for thirteen years as when she was a young girl, her mother taught her how to embroider. It's generated a reasonable income and profit over the years so she has been able to contribute to household finances.

Now Cristina is seeking a loan of Q3,000.00 to buy different coloured thread to make the clothing as each day brings an increase in business. Her dream is generate more income through her business so she can save enough money to build a house and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy thread to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William used his previous loan to buy cassava to sell.  He is a 44-year-old married man, with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in the cassava-milling business for four years.  With his earnings he was able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He also has tree nursery beds, and he supplies tree seedlings to farmers around the area.

His family goal is to educate his children up to the university, while his business plans are to buy more land to plant more trees and to diversify his business so he can mill other cereals, like beans and maize.  

William intends to use the loan to buy a coffee-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a coffee-milling machine

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a forty-seven-year-old married man with nine children living in Kasese,Uganda. For seven years he has been in agriculture and he also earns a monthly salary as a teacher. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and set up sustainable income generating activities. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect his business growth while his plans are to venture into modern farming methods. Augustine intends to use the money to buy seeds, rent land to farm on and buy agrochemicals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, rent land to farm on and buy agrochemicals.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a forty-two-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in the transport business for thirteen years, practices agriculture and also operates a salon. The high cost of fuel and poor roads are his major challenges while his dreams are buying a bus, educating his children up to the university level and building a permanent residential house. Musa intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.name: Ester Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Ester es una mujer casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su esposo y contribuyen en las diferentes labores que diariamente se realizan en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café como; poda, limpieza, aplicación de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, etc. que dan una mayor protección y seguridad a sus cultivos de café. Ella tiene una edad de 42 años y un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres.
