For this reason he is applying for a loan in order to pay for this course which is so important for his personal development and so that he can work in his chosen field

loans.use: to pay fees and for his degree title.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro tiene 35 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi hace 1 año. Inicio esta actividad con dinero propio junto al apoyo de su hermano y padre, quien le cedió la línea de taxi para que trabajase de manera independiente. Solicita el crédito para cancelar el pago de su vehículo ya que tiene un saldo pendiente. Se considera una persona con muchos deseos de superación que con esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación podrá adquirir mayores ingresos, para el bienestar de su familia y del mismo. Estima que al adquirir el crédito podrá tener tranquilidad para trabajar, ya que tendrá un plazo de pagos mensuales para la cancelación del préstamo que  Kiva y MiCredito le otorgase.
texts.en: Pedro is 35 years old and originally from the city of Estelí.  He has been making a living as a taxi driver for a year.  He started this work with his own money, and with the support of his brother and his father, who gave him the taxi line so that he could work independently.  Pedro is applying for this loan in order to pay off his vehicle.  Pedro says that he has a lot of desires to get ahead and thinks that with effort, hard-work, and dedication he can earn a higher income for his and his family's income.  He believes that with this loan he can work in peace as he will have a monthly repayment plan for the Kiva and MiCredito loan.

loans.use: to pay off his vehicle.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Enhbat, is currently attending OT, a big mining project of Mongolia, training for organic vegetable growing. Her children attend local school and kindergarten. Lhamsuren has been running her grocery store business for years and now she is planning to grow organic vegetables in their plot of land with her husband and sell them at her store. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables, seeds and soil to make her new business idea happen. Lhamsuren is an optimistic, welcoming and hard-working lady.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables, seeds and soil to make her new business idea happen

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos is from Chrang Chamreh Muoy of Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. She is 53 years old and lives in a family of six members. She has a position in a local market, selling beef with her spouse from a rented booth. She is friendly and sells meats at a reasonable price, which is the reason why she can attract more customers to buy her products. Having been in this business for years, she is able to make a net profit of 5.60 US dollars per day.

Sos has requested a loan amounting to 600 US dollars for the purchase of meat to stabilize her vending business. Her goal is to make a stable income; otherwise her income is hardly enough to cover her living costs. She plans to use some of the profit she expects to generate as a result of the loan for her daily needs and will save the rest for the future expansion of her business. She thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase meat to stabilize her vending business.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
As a parent of two children who are in school, Paz works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Paz is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, etc. for her food vending business.

Paz has been sustaining her business activities through the past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 37 years old and married with six children. With six children currently in school, Narfe works very hard to provide for them.

Narfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store including soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, and shampoo.

Narfe has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, shampoo, etc. 

Narfe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store including soft-drinks, detergent soap, canned goods, and shampoo.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a buying and selling banana business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling feed in the Philippines.  She earns additional income from a general store and by farming rice and corn. Tessie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of feed to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de ganaderia y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de quesos y yogurt,la socia a los ganados los ahce crecer y luego los vende,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los quesos,yogures y quesos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ganados y alimentos para los ganados.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works in ranching and also cheese and yogurt selling. She finishes cattle and then sells them. She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She wants to get ahead this way. Her dream is to have her own business site where she could sell cheese and yogurt. She is applying for this loan to buy livestock and livestock feed. 

She's happy for the loan and she's committed to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy livestock and livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the business tricycle unit.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to Samuel, who is a butcher, and she supports a family of three children, ages 19, 16 and 7 years old.

She has a general store where she sells all manner of items, ranging from beauty products to food stuff and household goods such as utensils. This business has been in operation for the past year. To enable her to stock it even more, she has applied for her second loan of KES 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and she plans to use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Margaret hopes to own a supermarket and have better living standards.

loans.use: to expand her general shop by stocking it with buckets, cosmetics and drums.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen resides in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. She  is married and has five school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer and Belen operates a service-based business providing parlor services in the local community. Belen has been involved in her business for eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belen has successfully repaid a previous loan that was used in her business' improvement. Belen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase parlor accessories, hair medicine and treatment. She plans to use the profit generated from the parlor to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase parlor accessories, hair medicine and treatment.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. She is 60 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer and Estella helps to operate a banana production farm. She has been engaged in her business for 14 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estella joined GDMPC. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for fertilizer. She is requesting a loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish and other sea-foods to sell in her food stall.

Melanie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Melanie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling roasted whole chicken in the Philippines.

Catalina requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional chicken and spices for her business.

Catalina has been in this business for 30 years now.

Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional chicken and spices for her business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 60 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Lydia, who is a farmer, and he has eight children ages 34, 32, 30, 28, 26, 24, 22 and 18 years old.

He has been running his butcher shop for the past 13 years. To assist him to be in constant supply of meat to his customers, he has applied for his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy goats and sheep for slaughter.

Jackson's income per month is KES 30,000, and he intends to use the profits from his expanded business for paying school fees for his children who are in college.

In the future, he hopes to open several butcher shops and buy a plot on which he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep to slaughter, then sell the meat from his butchery.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Rosemarie has been in this business for 3 years now.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand hopes to achieve abundant harvest to help pay for the education of his children in order for them to earn a degree, which is the only legacy he could pass on to them when he returns to dust. 

Ferdinand is 49 years old, a father to his five children, three of whom attend college. His wife also cooks and sells food for snacks and daily meals to supplement the income derived from farming. 

Ferdinand owns and manages a 1.5 hectare of rice field where he plants and harvests rice to sell. Ferdinand is now borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides he needs to till and maintain his farm for a better yield. This will help ensure the good nutrition of his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides to till and maintain his farm for a better yield.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 31-years-old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Estela is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs.

Estela has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell coconut wine.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susana is 50 years old.

Susana has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Susana has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en:
Ma. Niña is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Niña is 34 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Ma. Niña has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. Ma. Niña requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment of her business.

Ma. Niña has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Niña would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment of her business.

loans.name: Merry

texts.en:
Merry is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are still in school.

Merry is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Merry requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

Merry has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merry would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and vaccines for her cattle.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 67 years old and from Olkalou, Kenya. He is married to a woman named Elizabeth.  He has seven children aged 35, 32, 22, 22, 18, 10 and 8 years old.

He is a farmer who practices mixed farming and has been into this business for the past 35 years.  He has applied for a loan of 90,000 Kenyan shillings from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy planting seeds, fertilizers and herbicides so as to be more productive in his farming activities. He is also going to use some of this money to pay laborers who will be cultivating on his farm.

His monthly income right now is 40,000 Kenyan shilling and he hopes to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to improve his farming activities by buying seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and hiring laborers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell to her customers.

Erlinda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Erlinda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Nusrat. She is married and has four daughters and three sons; she is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

In 1995, her husband established a bushiness of clothes selling in his nearby town. Now, his young children are growing and their needs as well. With the rapid increase in the necessities of family, he wants to grow his business also. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family, so he wants to grow his current business but does not have sufficient money.

Because of that, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy a variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell.

Nusrat hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the enterprise of her husband and in her family as well.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy variety of clothes for ladies and gents to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is involved in transport business and agriculture, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay the school fees for his children. His dream is to educate his children up to the university, and set up sustainable income-generating activities for them.

Poor roads, unpredictable weather changes, and high fuel prices are his major challenges. His dreams are to construct a permanent house and expand his farming activities. 

Charles intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to sell.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old from Olkalou, Kenya.  He is married to Diana who is a farmer, and they have four children aged 16, 11, 9 and 3 years old.

He is in the business of mixed farming which he has practiced for the past ten years and has enabled him be more productive. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET Ltd which he is going to use to purchase a cow for his farm.

His monthly income right now is 20,000 Kenyan shillings and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay his loan and to educate his children.

Paul hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land and be happy with his family.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his farm.

loans.name: Uwemacho Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwakakoko est âgée de 46 ans et mère de 10 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est secrétaire du groupe d’affaire « Uwe Macho ». Son mari est auditeur financier auprès d'une entreprise hôtelière. La cliente est  entrepreneur et propriétaire  d’un cafeteria (petit restaurant). Elle démarra son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 3 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira d’acheter 3 sacs de pomme de terre,  2 bidons d’huile végétale, 50 kg de riz, les poissons, la viande, le lait, etc. Dans le futur, elle compte accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir,  soigner ses enfants. Elle adresse ses remerciements à Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
The client Mwakakoko is 46 years old and mother of 10 children, all attending school. She is the secretary of the "Uwe Macho" business group. Her husband is a financial auditor with a hotel company.

The client is an entrepreneur and owner of a cafeteria (small restaurant). She started her business with her own funds received from her husband. She has been running the business for the past three years.

She will use this new loan to buy three bags of potatoes, two cans of vegetable oil, 50 kg of rice, fish, meat, milk, etc..

In the future, she intends to increase her working capital, and also educate, feed, and take care of her children. She wishes to thank Hekima for its support to non-bankable women.

loans.use: buy 3 bags of potatoes, 2 cans of vegetable oil, 50 kg of rice, fish, meat, milk, etc..

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Vecelina

texts.en:
Vecelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.  Vecelina has been in this business for 6 years now.

Vecelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with ten children, three of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.  Erlinda has been in this business for 6 years.

Erlinda runs a buy-and-sell bag business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional assorted bags to sell.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase assorted bags to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more scrap to sell for her buy and sell scrap materials business.

Lucrecia has been in this business for two years. Lucrecia earns more income from her general store.

Lucrecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 43 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Veronica is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Veronica has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mishal

texts.en:
Mishal is a 23-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child.  She is living with her husband and parents. She does not do any job; she stays at home and looks after her child and parents.

Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about four years. During this time, he has been driving his rickshaw continuously. Now he needs to maintain the rickshaw's important parts.
 
Her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he knows that BRAC Pakistan provides loans with easy terms and conditions. He sent his wife to BRAC's nearby branch for her first loan with Kiva. She hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make the payments on time.

Mishal requested a loan from Kiva. Her husband will use this amount to buy spare parts for the vehicle, such as tires, bolts, headlights, and tubes and to pay for the maintenance of his auto rickshaw.

loans.use: to maintain an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 30 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Florita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from electronic load retailing.

Florita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson, a father of three children, is 42 years old and lives in Divisoria. He needed financial assistance in order to get an additional labor force for his farming business. Therefore, he requested from lenders a loan to pay for the labor costs and to buy fertilizer and seeds. He wants the best for his family so he is working hard for them through farming. Furthermore, his dream to see his three children finish their studies in college and somehow be employed in decent jobs is an ultimate goal for Nelson, so he is very patient and sacrifices a lot in his farming to earn enough income.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Yandè

texts.fr:
Madame Yandè est une femme très active qui évolue dans le domaine du stockage de céréales, ou elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Elle travaille de 6h du matin à 14h de l’après midi. Son activité consiste à stocker du mil, des arachides et d’autres variétés de céréales pendant des mois et de le revendre pendant la période de pénurie à un prix supérieur au prix d’acquisition. Elle est une habituée de l’IMCEC car elle en est à son cinquième crédit. 
Yandè est mariée et mère de famille. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et veille au bien être de toute la famille, là est son objectif principal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yande is a very active woman who has been involved in the storage of grain, where she has over 10 years' experience. She works from 6 am to 2 in the afternoon.

Her business activity is to store millet, peanuts and other varieties of cereals for several months and resell them at a higher price during the shortage period. She is no stranger to the IMCEC as she is on her fifth credit loan.

Yande is married and a mother. She participates in daily expenditures and ensures the well-being of the whole family, which is her main objective.

loans.use: buy grain, millet, peanuts...to store and resell later

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 32-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his eldest son by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. He teaches his son how to convince the customers and how to tackle a hyper customer. His son helps his father after attending school.  
Shabana is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care.
Shabana wants to grow the business of her husband so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakista, so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, and she in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, soap, detergent, biscuits, bubbles, candies etc to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for six years now.

Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old, and her children are in school.

Janice has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase raw materials such as shells and nylon threads for her business.

Janice has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as shells and nylon threads for her business

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman 28 years old, married with 3 children. He lives in Duanguican,Tudela, Philippines.
Herman is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 2 years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other corn crops, chemicals such as corn rootworm protection, seed falters, insecticidal viruses, etc.
Herman has been a member of PMPC for a month.  He hopes to use the additional income to prepare for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other corn crops chemicals such as corn rootworm protection, seed falters and insecticidal virus.

loans.name: Ayaba Louise's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représente du groupe, nommée Ayaba Louise (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 57 ans. Ayaba Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Louise est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Ayaoba. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Ayaba Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ces enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Ayaba Louise et son mari. Pour ce faire Ayaba Louise vend divers produits (huile et maïs) à son domicile depuis dix sept ans. Ayaba Louise s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ayaba Louise s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of four people who live in the same neighborhood. The person representing the group is named Ayaba Louise (the one with the raised hand on the photo); she is 57 years old. 

Ayaba Louise did not attend school. She is married to a driver named Ayaoba. The couple has four children, some of whom attend school and three of whom are their dependents. Ayaba Louise lives with her ​​husband and children. She shares the household expenses with her husband.

To accomplish this Ayaba Louise has been selling various products (corn oil) from her home for the past seventeen years. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to strengthen her business Ayaba Louise joins other members of her group in seeking a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy corn and vegetable oil

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 63 years old and married with eleven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sugar, soap, eggs, bread, canned goods, shampoo and groceries to sell.  She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Adelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar, soap, eggs, bread, canned goods, shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d‘habillement, de chaussure, de savon, céréales des produits cosmétiques  tubercules des tissus et d’articles divers.                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe  BENKADI, sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.                  
La cliente FATOUMATA  première debout à droite est vendeuse d’habillement. Elle compte acheter 8 rouleaux de pagnes chez les grossistes à Barouéli. Elle effectuera ses ventes quotidiennement à Barouéli et à Kinda au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité d’habillement.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group of women, all married, are on average 35 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the city of Barouéli, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell clothing, shoes, soap, cereal, cosmetics, tubers, fabrics and various items. The BENKADI group of women are on their fifteenth group loan.

Member FATOUMATA, the first person standing on the right, sells clothing. She plans to buy eight rolls of pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) from wholesalers in Barouéli.

She conducts her daily sales in Barouéli for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay her contributions to social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in the clothing business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe NAFAMA, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli,  Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de la restauration, d’habillement, de l’essence.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe  NAFAMA, sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire. La cliente TENIN assise en deuxième position à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 250kg de riz et des condiments chez les grossistes à Barouéli pour sa gargote. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement dans sa gargote à Barouéli au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de restauration.
texts.en:
The NAFAMA group of women, all married, are on average 35 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the city of Barouéli, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell tubers, clothing, gasoline, and offer catering. The NAFAMA group of women are on their twentieth group loan.

Member TENIN is sitting second from the left. She will buy 250 kg of rice and condiments from wholesalers in Barouéli for her tavern. She conducts her sales daily in her Barouéli tavern, for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs that will be used to pay her contributions to social ceremonies, and the rest will be reinvested in the restaurant business.

loans.use: Buying ingredient for a restaurant business

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENDIYA est composé  exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 39 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, des condiments, du manioc, de l’habillement, du poisson, des céréales, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe BENDIYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
La cliente Doussou, la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises,  compte acheter une balle de friperie avec les fournisseurs de Bamako, pour ensuite revendre aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de tubercule.
texts.en:
The BENDIYA group is composed exclusively of married women, who average 39 years of age with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell peanuts, condiments, cassava, clothing, fish, cereals, etc.. The BENDIYA group of women are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy their goods.

Member Doussou, the person sitting in the middle, intends to buy a bale of used clothing from providers in Bamako, and then resell them to customers in the village and the surrounding area.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 32,000 CFA francs which will be used for the needs of the family, and some of which will be reinvested in the tuber retail business.

loans.use: buy used clothes

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEME, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Madoudiarrabougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’arachide, des condiments, du manioc, de l’habillement du poisson des céréales.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
Avec ce prêt, la cliente Sourakata, la première personne à gauche dans le rang des personnes debout,  compte acheter 5 sacs d’oignon, une boîte de concentrée de tomate, 1carton de cube maggi, du poivre de l’aubergine avec les fournisseurs à Fana. Ces condiments seront vendus  aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses familiales
texts.en:
The DEME group is composed exclusively of married women who on average are 47 years old with three children. All live in traditional extended families in the village of Madoudiarrabougou, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell peanuts, condiments, cassava, fish, cereals, clothing. The women of the DEME group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy their goods.

Member Sourakata, the first standing on the left, plans to use this loan to buy five bags of onions, a can of tomato paste, one carton of Maggi cubes,  pepper, and eggplants from suppliers in Fana. These condiments are resold to customers in the village and the surrounding area.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs to be used for family expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan is 42 years old, lives in Divisoria and is a father to a four school aged children. He is a hardworking farmer and has been in his business for more than 10 years. Every harvest season, he is earning an income of PHP 20,000 which is just enough for their basic needs. His wife served as cook in a restaurant and he wants to help her earn a bigger income than the usual to provide for the growing needs of his children in school. 

Roldan is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy herbicides and crude oil for his farming business. In the future, he wants to see his family in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and crude oil for his farming business.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is married with one child. Bernie is 48 years old and lives in Duanguican,Tudela, Philippines.

Bernie sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, sweet candies, junk foods, seasonings, soaps, detergents, etc. 

He has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Bernie hopes to save more.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, sweet candies, soaps, detergents etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is from Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has nine children living nearby. Regina used her previous loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Her business has grown and she gains more harvest. To make her farm expansion, she needs enough money to cover the costs of farm plowing and fertilization. An amount of 50,000 PHP will make it successful. She is thankful to GDMPC for giving trusts that helps improve their living situation.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm plowing and fertilization.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 50-year-old married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a teacher and he was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. He has the hardships of low pay and poor working conditions, while his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture.

William intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly works hard to support her family. Gerly is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gerly has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gerly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, four of whom in school, Aileen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from porticulture business. Aileen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Aileen has been sustaining her business activities through the past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes to sell.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisseme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  de Badialan dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  de charbon, de céréales et d’articles divers tels les articles de poteries.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises citées ci-dessus.                                                                                                                                                                                                
La cliente Chata, la personne assise à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter 50 canaris, 10 jarres à Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA qui sera réutilisé dans l’activité
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made exclusively of married women, who, on average, are 46 years old and have five children. All live in traditional extended families in the Badialan neighborhood in the town of Fana, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell condiments, charcoal, cereals, and other diverse goods like pottery. The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their sixth group loan, and will use it to buy the various merchandise described above.

Chata, the person seated on the right, plans to buy 50 canaris [a type of pottery container] and 10 jars in Fana. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will reuse in her business.

loans.use: to buy pottery

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr:
Monsieur Edouard évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage plus précisément de l’embouche bovine. Il commence sa journée à 6h du matin et la termine à 14h.Son activité consiste à acheter des bœufs, à les élever dans le but de les revendre dans les marchés.
Edouard habite dans un village situé à environs moins de 30km de la ville principale. Il est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne et de leurs principaux  besoins. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter un ou deux bœufs pour augmenter son cheptel.
Si les ventes sont bonnes, il espère pouvoir construire sa propre maison pour y abriter son foyer et les mettre dans les meilleures conditions.
texts.en:
Edouard raises and sells cows for a living. He starts his day at 6 a.m. and finishes at 2 p.m. His business consists of buying cattle and then raising them with the goal of reselling them in the markets.

Edouard lives in a village situated at least 30 kilometers from the main town. He is married and a father to a family. He is responsible for the everyday expenses and [his family's] basic needs.

He comes for the first time to seek a loan of 150,000 francs CFA in order to buy one or two cows to help expand his herd. If the sales are good, he hopes to be able to build a nice house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
La cliente DJENEBOU, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche  compte acheter deux sacs d’oignon, un sac de choux pommé, dix kilogramme de poisson fumés et un sac de sel avec les revendeurs de la place, qu’elle revend sur place au marché et à domicile aux clientes et clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made exclusively of married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, in the Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell condiments or work in food preparation. The women of the Danaya group are on their fourth group loan.

Djenebou, the person standing second from the left, plans to buy two bags of onions, a sac of cauliflower, 10 kilograms of smoked fish, and a sac of salt from retailers in the area, which she will then resell in a market and from home to customers and townspeople.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 francs CFA, which will be used to support the needs of her family and to reinvest in her business of selling condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente AWA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 4 sacs d’arachide avec les revendeurs de Dioïla, qu’elle transforme en pâte d’arachide destinée à la vente au marché et à domicile aux ménagères de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell condiments and work in food preparation [for a living]. The women of the Benkadi group are on their fifth group loan.

Awa, the first person standing on the left, plans to buy four sacs of groundnuts from sellers in Dioila that she will make into groundnut spread destined to be resold in a market and from home to different households. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA which will be used to support her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Faïda, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de poissons frais, de condiments et la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Faïda sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente AWA, personne au milieu, compte acheter trois paniers de poisson frais à Bamako, qu’elle revend tantôt frais tantôt cuit à domicile aux clientes et clients de la ville.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The Faida group is made up exclusively of married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioila, Koulikoro region (in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell fresh fish, condiments, and work in food preparation [for a living]. The women of the Faida group are on their fifth group loan.

Awa, the person standing in the middle, plans to buy three baskets of fresh fish in Bamako, then resell it from home, either fresh or cooked, to customers and townspeople.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA which will be used to support the needs of her family and to reinvest in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is married with three children. Leila is 36 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Leila sells variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Leila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Leila hopes to pay her children's tuition fees and also to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is married with one child. Novelyn is 24 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Philippines. 

Novelyn sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, sweet candies, junk foods, sugars, seasonings, detergents, soaps, etc. 

Novelyn has been a member of PMPC for nine months. In the future, Novelyn hope to pay her children's tuition fees and to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, sweet candies, junk foods, sugars, seasonings, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is married with three children. Marrieta is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Marrieta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional materials needed to repair her house such as nails, plywood, cement, corrugated bars, plain sheets etc. and also to buy additional piglets.

Marrieta has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marrieta hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed to repair her house and to buy additional piglets.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is married with three children. Franklin is 39 years old and lives in Duanguican, Philippines.

Franklin sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, he earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, sugar, seasonings, eggs, detergents, soaps,etc.

Franklin has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Franklin hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sweet candies, junk foods, drinks, beverages, sugar, seasonings, eggs, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is 55 years old and lives in Sto. Niño Pagadian City. She is married with seven children.

Celedonia has a tailoring business and earns eight thousand pesos only (8,000) a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting twenty thousand pesos only (20,000) to buy more textiles.

She has been a member for four years. In the future she hopes she can buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy textiles.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is widowed with 5 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Buenavista,Tudela, Philippines. Avelina is a farmer and grows corn crops and flowers to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers for her flowers and corn crops. Avelina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Avelina hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her flowers and corn crops

loans.name: Corazón De María  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazón de María está formado por 9 mujeres que son amigas, a diario trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que le dan la oportunidad de solventar sus gastos y mejorar la economía de sus hogares, todas son personas amables y muy gentiles. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió y su geografía accidentada da lugar a bellos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, crianza de animales y el comercio.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gladys, es una socia que se encuentra en el grupo de crédito Corazón de María desde hace 4 años, en todo este tiempo ha establecido mejores lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le han permitido tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

La Señora Gladys tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 23, 22, 17 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su segundo y tercer hijo están trabajando y le ayudan económicamente, su última hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Gladys se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar desde hace 6 años se dedica lavar ropa ajena, también hay días que le llaman para que labore como jornalera y en casa cría cuyes y pollos. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es hacer un galpón de pollos más grande y crecer en esta actividad.
texts.en:
The group Corazón de María is made up of nine women, who are all friends. Every day they work doing different activities, which give them the opportunity to settle their expenses and improve the economy of their homes. They are all kind and courteous people. They live in the surroundings of Valle parish in Cuenca. This area has a cold climate and its uneven geography makes for beautiful landscapes to enjoy. The main economic activities are agriculture, animal breeding, and trade.

One of the members of this group is Gladys. She has been a member of Corazón de María for four years, and over this time has established better friendship ties with all her fellow members, At the same time, the loans have allowed her to have better economic stability.

Gladys is 38 years old and married. She has four children as a result of her marriage, aged 23, 22, 17, and 14 years. Her eldest daughter is married but lives in her house and shares the household expenses. Her second and third eldest children, who are sons, are working and helping her economically. Her youngest child, a daughter, is studying at a school in the city. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and the house in which they live is their own.

Gladys spends her time doing the household chores, but to contribute to her household’s economy she has been washing other people's clothes for six years. There are also days when she is called to work as a day labourer, and she breeds guinea pigs and chickens at home.

She is going to invest her new loan in purchasing chickens and animal feed.

Her goals are to make a larger chicken shed and grow in this business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a forty-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a clothing business for seventeen years and with the proceeds she has been able to support her husband with family basics.

Ever-changing customer preferences and price fluctuations affect her business growth while her dream is to own a boutique.

Dorothy intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 64 years old and is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jesusa has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

Jesusa has been in this business for 11 years. Jesusa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell on her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 34-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a policeman and was inspired into service by his desire to serve his nation. 

He is challenged by the fact that his meager salary can hardly meet the basic needs of his family while his desire is to venture into commercial agriculture. Vicent is requesting a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old, single and works hard to support her parents.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Analiza is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her buy-and-sell-fish business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of 9 children. She belongs to a huge family and sometimes it is very difficult for her to feed each of her children each day. She has to face a very tough time due to lack of finance.

In fact her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He does not have any other source of income except the rickshaw. He has to do a lot of hard work by day and night to get a reasonable income. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Khalida has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some do some maintenance on the engine which is needed for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service for his passengers. 

Khalida is hopeful that the rainy days will come to an end one day and this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes for her family. Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on the auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en:
Ismat is a 50-years-old married man. He raises sheep and sells them for meat. Ismat has been doing this business for 10 years and is a very hard-working person. He puts a lot of effort in this activity because he wants to support his family.

Ismat keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar for the butchers and customers purchase. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc. 

He has taken a loan previously and he has a good loan history. This will be his   second  loan. This time he requires 1,700 AZN to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn. Ismat is optimistic about this loan because in the autumn more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children. He repairs cars in his garage and he also does welding for the maintenance of cars. He has been doing this job for more than 14 years. Asif says that it’s very hard work but to take care of his family he must work. His profit from this business is about 100 AZN a month. 

Asif wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery for his garage. With a good loan history, he has applied for his sixth loan of  1,800 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery for his garage.

loans.name: Doroteo

texts.en: Doroteo is 41 years old, has two children, and lives in Divisoria. He is a hardworking farmer and he wants to provide for the needs of his family. He owns a rice field with an area of one half hectare and every harvest season he earns an average net profit of 20,000 PHP. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pesticides and seeds for his farming needs. He is looking forward to securing his family's living by maintaining his business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for his farming needs.

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Mahir is a 55 year old married man with 2 kids. He is a market vendor and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in his place at a central bazaar and from his home.  Mahir has 10 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable suppliers. 

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table of Azerbaijan's families and are also used to make fresh punch. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

He applied for an 1,800 AZN loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover. This will be his 6th loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Mtongani-Daraja Group

texts.en:
Habiba, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three children (all girls); two are in school. For fifteen years now, Habiba has been managing her life by running different businesses: she own a beauty salon, a second-hand clothes business and she also sells water. Habiba is doing all of these activities from her house. She starts working from 6am until 9pm daily and is able to make a very good returns per month. 

This is is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Habiba will use this loan to improve her beauty salon by buying another drier and increase the clothes she has to resell. She dreams of expanding more her enterprises. 

Habiba will share this loan with her loan group "Mtongani-Daraja" which is comprised of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a salon drier and more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib is 39 years old and married, with two children. He has a shop, and he has been in business for six years. He sells toys, perfumes, jewelry and other small goods. His wife also provides income for the family. She works as a cleaner at the hospital. 

Sahib needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This is his fourth loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy new items for his shop. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new items for his shop.

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz is a 41-year-old woman married with one daughter. Aybaniz is a merchant. She sells household goods for the home.

She is a very hard-working woman. She takes care of her family. Aybaniz works the whole day. She has been in this field for ten years. Her neighbors were her first clients, and then day-by-day she expanded her business and opened a large market. Now she needs a loan of  2,000 AZN to buy more household products because people often ask her for a good she doesn't have. 

This is her 4th loan and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more household products.

loans.name: Sayad

texts.en:
Sayad is a 56-year-old married woman with three kids. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Sayad’s income is 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and she is doing it together with her husband.  Sayad keeps a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Sayad is applying for a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn. She is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya is 60 years old. She operates her general store where she sells shampoo, dishwasher and detergent powders, hand soap, toothpaste, etc. She   works very hard to provide for her family. She is making good money from selling goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. Asiya is requesting an 1,800 azn loan to buy items for her store. She has a good client history and this is going to be her 5th loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is a 35-year-old married father of two kids. His wife is a housewife. He is a popular merchant in his hometown, because his shop is situated in the center of town. It has already been seven years since he started selling food products. His profit from this business is about 150 AZN a month. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar, and beverages in his shop. 

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest into his business to cover his customers' demands. For this reason he is suffering. His shop is the family's main source of income, and his profit is used for their needs. Teymur would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. He applied for a 1,800 AZN loan for this purpose. He will purchase additional food products and diversify. This will be his 6th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products and diversify.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 45 years old and lives in Buenvavista, Pagadian City. She is married with five children. Felicisima has a business selling a banana cue to earn a living. She earns only about eight thousand pesos (8,000 PHP) each month doing this type of work. Felicisima requested a loan of only ten thousand pesos (10,000 PHP) to buy new plastic ware for stock storage and bananas.

Felicisima has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Felicisima would like to have her own stall to display her food.

loans.use: to buy new plastic ware for stock storage.

loans.name: Eutopia

texts.en: Eutopia is 59 years old and lives in Sto. Nino Pagadian City. She is married with six children. Eutopia has a dressmaking business and earns fifteen thousand pesos a month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of only fourteen thousand five hundred pesos (14,500 PHP). Eutopia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Eutopia hopes to buy a new electronic sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy one roll of fabric.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 40 years old and lives is Sto. Nino Pagadian City. She is married with one child.

Elisa sells beauty products and earns fifteen thousand pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of only ten thousand pesos (10,000 PHP) to buy new beauty products. 

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Elisa hopes to have her own shop to display her beauty products.

loans.use: To buy new beauty products.

location.town: Pagadian-Sto. Nino, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del S

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is widowed with 3 children. Nemesia is 59 years old and lives in Tudela, Philippines.

Nemesia is a farmer and grows banana and corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizer and other chemicals for corn-pests prevention such as flock buster, barley yellow dwarf virus, corn borers, etc.

Nemesia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Nemesia hopes to include other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and other chemicals for corn-pests prevention.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married with 5 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tonggo,Tudela, Philippines.

Trinidad  is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 7 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers such as urea, potassium sulfate, ammonium nitrate, etc.

Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Trinidad hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is married with two children. Marion is 36 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines.

Marion is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to pay for additional dried copra to sell.

Marion has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Marion hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to pay for additional dried copra to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with six children. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Padian City Zamboanga del Sur Philippines.

Emma is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan to buy more feeds and vitamins for her sow.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she wants to buy more sows to raise.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her sow.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang, Pagadian City, Zam

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Pablita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She requested a loan to build a bigger pig tent.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to build a pig tent

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang  Pagadian City

loans.name: Baby Grace

texts.en:
Baby Grace is 30-years-of-age and a resident of Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with two kids. They have a little fishing business from which they earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Baby Grace and her husband work hard selling their catch in the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 14,900 loan. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Baby Grace smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 55 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Pedrita has a store business selling a variety of goods. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Pedrita has  requested a loan to purchase additional inventory.

Pedrita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Pedrita would like to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is 54 years old and married with three adult-aged children. He is a very caring and responsible father engaged in farming activities. He has been in this business for many years and he earns income that is just enough for the basic needs of his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of his farm. He hopes that from the generous lenders' help, his business income will grow further for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for the maintenance of his farming.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 48 years old from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. Merlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for a living. She has been in business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP per month. Aside from this, she also buys coconuts, bananas and charcoal to resell in bulk. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used in her farm. Recently,  Merlinda requested a loan of 60,000 PHP to purchase more charcoal, coconuts and bananas to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, coconuts and bananas to resell

loans.name: Ananbel

texts.en:
Ananbel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a movable cart of vegetables and spices business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Ananbel has been in this business for 2 years. Ananbel earns more income from farming coconut.

Ananbel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Pemy

texts.en:
This is Pemy, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a mason and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pemy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Pemy hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.
